commit_message:
Release blazar-nova for Yoga-1 milestone

This is a library release for blazar-nova for the Yoga-1
milestone. This repository contains commits that have not been releases
for this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Ia7a220d88c74851c9bd49f2e513433de21f917ba

The libvirt driver power on and hard reboot destroys the domain first

However nova does not wait for the network-vif-plugged event before
unpause the domain. This can cause that the domain starts running and
requesting IP via DHCP before the networking backend finished plugging

network-vif-plugged events during hard reboot the same way as nova waits
for this event during new instance spawn.

This logic cannot be enabled unconditionally as not all neutron
networking backend sending plug time events to wait for. Also the logic
needs to be vnic_type dependent as ml2/ovs and the in tree sriov backend
often deployed together on the same compute. While ml2/ovs sends plug
time event the sriov backend does not send it reliably. So the
configuration is not just a boolean flag but a list of vnic_types
instead. This way the waiting for the plug time event for a vif that is
handled by ml2/ovs is possible while the instance has other vifs handled
by the sriov backend where no event can be expected.

Closes-Bug: #1946729

commit_message:
Add a WA flag waiting for vif-plugged event during reboot

The libvirt driver power on and hard reboot destroys the domain first
and unplugs the vifs then recreate the domain and replug the vifs.
However nova does not wait for the network-vif-plugged event before
unpause the domain. This can cause that the domain starts running and
requesting IP via DHCP before the networking backend finished plugging
the vifs.

So this patch adds a workaround config option to nova to wait for
network-vif-plugged events during hard reboot the same way as nova waits
for this event during new instance spawn.

This logic cannot be enabled unconditionally as not all neutron
networking backend sending plug time events to wait for. Also the logic
needs to be vnic_type dependent as ml2/ovs and the in tree sriov backend
often deployed together on the same compute. While ml2/ovs sends plug
time event the sriov backend does not send it reliably. So the
configuration is not just a boolean flag but a list of vnic_types
instead. This way the waiting for the plug time event for a vif that is
handled by ml2/ovs is possible while the instance has other vifs handled
by the sriov backend where no event can be expected.

Change-Id: Ie904d1513b5cf76d6d5f6877545e8eb378dd5499
Closes-Bug: #1946729

commit_message:
Fix service_auth.auth_url value in devstack

$OS_AUTH_URL was previously used to configure the service_auth.auth_url
setting in octavia.conf but this env var was removed from devstack in
[0]. Switch to $KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI which was used to set OS_AUTH_URL.

[0] I86ffa9cd52454f1c1c72d29b3a0e0caa3e44b829

Change-Id: I0d077e558ec44a4278a5f3b880fb7b6e84c501e9

commit_message:
Add the community validation paths

The validation framework now respect and look for community
validation on the path. There config setting for
enable_community_validations is respected.

The community validations appear on validations list,
can be called by group, category, id and so on seamless
like any other validation.

Change-Id: I4a6230ac5433028c7297fa88f77728c87d60173d
Signed-off-by: Adriano Petrich (apetrich) <apetrich@redhat.com>

commit_message:
task-core basic framework

This change adds a new output to service definitions called
core_services which are used to define task-core services that will be
collected and exported during the config-download progress. These
services are mapped to TripleO roles and published into a task-core role
file in the config-download.

Related-Blueprint: unified-orchestration
Change-Id: I6954ecc92e740212a4502ac5fa8e53eeed22d043
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/798721

commit_message:
ovn: Filter ACL columns when syncing the DB

The patch filters columns from OVN DB only to those that are used by the
ovn mechanism driver. It means generated ACLs from Neutron DB and ACLs
obtained from the OVN DB will always have the same columns. This is
useful for db sync script when comparing if given security group rule
has corresponding ACL in the OVN DB.

Closes-Bug: #1951296
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I39e3b987b8546fd970a933b846ed23c8a2588258

commit_message:
[OVS][QOS] Dataplane enforcement is limited to min-bw egress direction

OVS QoS extension only enforces dataplane traffic shapping for minimum
bandwidth rules with egress direction.

Change-Id: I57b274387505f42778f1d9d3ec2aa9feb5ae929d
Closes-Bug: #1949607

[{'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2021-06-29 13:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2021-06-29 13:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2021-06-29 13:52:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Sean reminds me on IRC that first we need to record the video model in 'system_metadata'..."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-06-29 15:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/798680/2/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 12m 31s'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2021-07-09 15:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-07-09 20:21:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/798680/3/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 16m 06s'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-07-09 21:08:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2021-08-04 14:27:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the review; I'll investigate further.

Meanwhile, I have gotten some real live migration tests done from a Red Hat virt QE:

- Have a Linux guest on source host with 'cirrus', change the model to 'virtio'; reboot the guest; and live-migrate: it succeeds

- Have a Windows guest on source host with 'cirrus', change the video model to 'virtio'; reboot the guest; and then live-migrate: it succeeds.

In addition, we also need to test hard reboots.

Sean on IRC also was wondering about the impact of 'hw_video_ram' on this switch to 'virtio'.  This remains to be tested; and also confirm the impact, if any, of video RAM on 'virtio' with the QEMU graphics folks."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-08-04 17:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2021-08-05 08:41:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Additional notes after talking to Gerd Hoffman from QEMU:

- Cirrus does not support 1080p at all: so moving from 'cirrus' to 'virtio-vga' fallback (in case the guest doesn't have the GPU driver) is completely fine in terms of video RAM
- When you're using 'virtio-vga' (with guest driver), there's no need for separate video RAM: as it uses main memory for framebuffers."}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2021-08-09 09:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-29 13:32:11.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Switch the default video model from 'cirrus' to 'virtio'

The current Nova default video device model of 'cirrus' was chosen by
commit 2c7dca4ede (Configuration element for describing video drivers,
2013-11-25).  While it has worked fine-enough for all these years,
Cirrus devices is is "considered harmful"[1] by QEMU graphics
maintainers since 2014.

The current recommended video device model for both UEFI and BIOS guests
is 'virtio'[1].  'virtio' is a sensible default whether or not the guest
has a native kernel (called "virtio-gpu" in Linux) driver -- i.e. if the
guest has a VirtIO GPU driver, then it uses it; otherwise, the 'virtio'
model falls back to the VGA compatibiliy mode.

To quote the documentation[2] from a QEMU graphics maintainer:

    This ['virtio' in libvirt or 'virtio-vga' in QEMU terms] is a
    modern, virtio-based display device designed for virtual machines.
    It comes with VGA compatibility mode. You need a guest driver to
    make full use of this device. If your guest OS has no driver it
    should still show a working display thanks to the VGA compatibility
    mode, but the device will not provide any advantages over standard
    VGA then.  [...] This is the place where most development happens,
    support for new, cool features will most likely be added to this
    device.

[1] "qemu: using cirrus considered harmful"
    https://www.kraxel.org/blog/2014/10/qemu-using-cirrus-considered-harmful/

[2] https://www.kraxel.org/blog/2019/09/display-devices-in-qemu/#virtio-vga

Change-Id: I4c999bb4120768af40093ddb1e6004ee33c9698f
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Switch the default video model from 'cirrus' to 'virtio'

The current Nova default video device model of 'cirrus' was chosen by
commit 2c7dca4ede (Configuration element for describing video drivers,
2013-11-25).  While it has worked fine-enough for all these years,
Cirrus devices is is "considered harmful"[1] by QEMU graphics
maintainers since 2014.

The current recommended video device model for both UEFI and BIOS guests
is 'virtio'[1].  'virtio' is a sensible default whether or not the guest
has a native kernel (called "virtio-gpu" in Linux) driver -- i.e. if the
guest has the VirtIO GPU driver, then it'll be used; otherwise, the
'virtio' model falls back to VGA compatibiliy mode.

To quote the documentation[2] from a QEMU graphics maintainer:

    This ['virtio' in libvirt or 'virtio-vga' in QEMU terms] is a
    modern, virtio-based display device designed for virtual machines.
    It comes with VGA compatibility mode. You need a guest driver to
    make full use of this device. If your guest OS has no driver it
    should still show a working display thanks to the VGA compatibility
    mode, but the device will not provide any advantages over standard
    VGA then.  [...] This is the place where most development happens,
    support for new, cool features will most likely be added to this
    device.

[1] "qemu: using cirrus considered harmful"
    https://www.kraxel.org/blog/2014/10/qemu-using-cirrus-considered-harmful/

[2] https://www.kraxel.org/blog/2019/09/display-devices-in-qemu/#virtio-vga

Implements: blueprint virtio-as-default-display-device

Change-Id: I4c999bb4120768af40093ddb1e6004ee33c9698f
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I138016c3363f8dd4f3b3eae6bd6357adcc8d5dd6

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update
this at each new cycle.

Change-Id: I45e0dcc6c215d0fb5f4e0d39298e8f5839f20e13

commit_message:
Increase integration tests timeout from 2h to 3h

Some of integration tests might run over 2 hours in loaded conditions.
Longer timeout allow tests to complete in all cases.

Signed-off-by: Oskari Lemmela <oskari@lemmela.net>
Change-Id: I58ec2b2d03713454bd9ed90427f3e3c70273f4d1

subject: always use real threads when polling ovs.
messages:
[{'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-06-10 14:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-06-10 15:39:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't know if this is going to be the fix for the connection problems in Nova, but at least in Neutron this is working: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/795820/"}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-06-10 15:44:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think this is the fix. As dicsussed on _SelectSelect is used, and since it is monkeypatched should yield. The get_system_poll() call is the only thing that returns an actual unpatched poll() implementation, and it is used only when calling open()/connect() in python-ovs which would match up to when the issue is showing up in nova."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-06-10 16:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-06-10 16:49:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The get_system_poll() call is the only thing that returns an actual unpatched poll() implementation, and it is used only when calling open()/connect() in python-ovs which would match up to when the issue is showing up in nova.

yes you are proably correct im going to try an monkey patch that form os-vif to have get_system_poll return _SelectSelect"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-06-10 17:06:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The get_system_poll() call is the only thing that returns an actual unpatched poll() implementation, and it is used only when calling open()/connect() in python-ovs which would match up to when the issue is showing up in nova.
> 
> yes you are proably correct im going to try an monkey patch that form os-vif to have get_system_poll return _SelectSelect

I'm wondering if that could help Neutron to avoid the recurrent hangs and timeouts we see in the OVS connection."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-06-10 19:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

just looking at the logs form the tempest run
the reconnect are not present in the n-cpu log with this applied'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-06-10 19:19:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> I don't think this is the fix. As dicsussed on _SelectSelect is used, and since it is monkeypatched should yield. The get_system_poll() call is the only thing that returns an actual unpatched poll() implementation, and it is used only when calling open()/connect() in python-ovs which would match up to when the issue is showing up in nova.

by the way provided those  open()/connect() in python-ovs  only happne in the new pthread this patch creates that will not block nova or neutron.

nova/osvif never calls start or stop and we only enque transacation to be executed by the other thread. so i think just using a real thread actully will fix it for client libs."}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-06-10 19:23:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > I don't think this is the fix. As dicsussed on _SelectSelect is used, and since it is monkeypatched should yield. The get_system_poll() call is the only thing that returns an actual unpatched poll() implementation, and it is used only when calling open()/connect() in python-ovs which would match up to when the issue is showing up in nova.
> 
> by the way provided those  open()/connect() in python-ovs  only happne in the new pthread this patch creates that will not block nova or neutron.
> 
> nova/osvif never calls start or stop and we only enque transacation to be executed by the other thread. so i think just using a real thread actully will fix it for client libs.

You call open/connect via calling a transaction that calls idl.run(), which steps through the reconnect.py state machine, which will reconnect as needed."}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-06-10 19:36:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

ovsdbapp uses threading.Threads in multiple places, with (most likely eventlet-patched by neutron) queues communicating between them, and locks that are held while executing transactions, etc. I'm just not at all comfortable with un-patching one of the threads.

I'm not saying it's not possible that I'm worrying unnecessarily, but I am going to need a lot of convincing that it's the only way to handle this."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-06-10 19:46:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The get_system_poll() call is the only thing that returns an actual unpatched poll() implementation, and it is used only when calling open()/connect() in python-ovs which would match up to when the issue is showing up in nova.
> >

> >

> 
> You call open/connect via calling a transaction that calls idl.run(), which steps through the reconnect.py state machine, which will reconnect as needed.

i dont think we call idl.run directly 

we crate transaction and add thing too them
https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/blob/e93736711920afe64a850f564dddefbd704975cd/vif_plug_ovs/ovsdb/ovsdb_lib.py#L113

there are no invokation of idl.run in os-vif
https://codesearch.opendev.org/?q=run&i=nope&files=&excludeFiles=&repos=openstack/os-vif

i tought we enqued the transaction in the connection via
queue_txn https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/src/branch/master/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/connection.py#L150

and then the connect trhead rand it in run 
https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/src/branch/master/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/connection.py#L108

that is how commiting a transaction works correct

https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/src/branch/master/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/transaction.py#L52-L66

so we shoudl never need to call  idl.run() on the eventlet thread it will only execute on the ovadbapp thread so if it calls the real poll that is ok because it wont block the eventlet thread where neutron and nova are running unless im missign something?"}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-06-10 20:15:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> 
> we crate transaction and add thing too them
> https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/blob/e93736711920afe64a850f564dddefbd704975cd/vif_plug_ovs/ovsdb/ovsdb_lib.py#L113
> 
> there are no invokation of idl.run in os-vif
> https://codesearch.opendev.org/?q=run&i=nope&files=&excludeFiles=&repos=openstack/os-vif
> 
> i tought we enqued the transaction in the connection via
> queue_txn https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/src/branch/master/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/connection.py#L150
> 
> and then the connect trhead rand it in run 
> https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/src/branch/master/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/connection.py#L108
> 
> that is how commiting a transaction works correct
> 
> https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/src/branch/master/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/transaction.py#L52-L66
> 
> so we shoudl never need to call  idl.run() on the eventlet thread it will only execute on the ovadbapp thread so if it calls the real poll that is ok because it wont block the eventlet thread where neutron and nova are running unless im missing something?

There is also the RowEventHandler thread, which will be a monkeypatched thread. When handling events in that thread, ml2/ovn calls sometimes calls back into the api code and will queue txns from that thread as well. Yes, idl.run() should always be called by the Connection thread.

Everything I've ever read on eventlet and threads warned against mixing native and greenthreads. Just one example: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/eventlet-best-practices.html which specifically uses mixing greenthreads/native threads as undefined and a bad idea and using monkey patching with threading=False as a bad idea.

Maybe this is the exception where it's totally fine. But if the problem is that python-ovs is using _SelectSelect in some cases and un-monkeypatched select.poll() in others, it seems like that is the bug we should be fixing. un-monkeypatching one of the threads in use seems like doubling down on the python-ovs bug to me."}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-06-11 05:30:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Ok. I did some (a lot of) research. The issue in ovs was introduced here: https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/c1aa16d191d267d76ce1d1459fe9ed6ab93e1f54

Read the commit message for the full story, but essentially select() would set POLLOUT for a socket that failed a connect() where poll() would not. The solution merged was to use system poll() in check_connection_completion() because you couldn't determine that the socket was going to error out before writing to it when using select(). This of course blocks in the case of using eventlet.

But, you *can* determine whether the socket is in an error state after connect(). According to the connect(2) manpage:

  It is possible to select(2) or poll(2) for completion by selecting the socket for writing.  After select(2) indicates  writability,  use  getsockopt(2)  to  read  the SO_ERROR option at level SOL_SOCKET to determine whether connect() completed successfully (SO_ERROR is zero) or unsuccessfully (SO_ERROR is one of the usual error codes listed here, explaining the reason for the failure).

This is a very simple patch to python-ovs which I will submit in 8 hours or so after I sleep."}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-06-11 13:59:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

OVS patch submitted for review here: https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/project/openvswitch/patch/20210611135339.443741-1-twilson@redhat.com/

If we didn't want to rely on the OVS code, we could add the patched check_connection_completion() to our own Stream subclasses, similar to what is done here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/794892/1/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py#75"}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-06-11 14:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

make that v2 of the patch :p https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/project/openvswitch/patch/20210611140902.458647-1-twilson@redhat.com/'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-06-11 14:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

*sigh* v3 https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/project/openvswitch/patch/20210611142923.474384-1-twilson@redhat.com/

partial reverts are tricky. :p Also gerrit > mailing lists for review. that is all.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-09-08 07:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Are we going to go this way?'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-11-18 15:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This should be fixed in upstream python-ovs by adding a cooperative_yield() method that can be overriden. ovsdbapp may go ahead and also add a default cooperative_yield() that is just time.sleep(0).'}]

commit_message:
always use real threads when polling ovs.

This change ensure that if ovsdbapp is used from
an application that use eventlets to monkeypatch the
standard lib treading, it will always use the unpatched
module to interact with threading.

Closes-Bug: #1929446
Change-Id: Ib4478ba091ed2c21f291a680d0f57322b7668536

[{'created': '2021-11-17 23:03:35.000000000', 'message': "CI: Get tinyipa build working for CI usage

The qemu git server has updated it's ssl certificate, and can no longer
be verified by the software libraries and embedded tinycore data for
the 10.x release. Unfortunately, we have CI hard coded to an older
release and we cannot release a newer, older version of the tinycore
10.x supporting packages.

So, for our CI purposes, we just need a working build, so that
is all this patch attempts to do, get our CI in a working state
for the older branches.

It is an awful change. None of us like it, but we're stuck and
this is the only path forward short of completely abandoning
the use of the software builds on these branches.

(cherry picked from commit 68961df8d57bf9f3fda1d81bbf71bca87a462738)
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Get tinyipa build working for CI usage

The qemu git server has updated it's ssl certificate, and can no longer
be verified by the software libraries and embedded tinycore data for
the 10.x release. Unfortunately, we have CI hard coded to an older
release and we cannot release a newer, older version of the tinycore
10.x supporting packages.

So, for our CI purposes, we just need a working build, so that
is all this patch attempts to do, get our CI in a working state
for the older branches.

It is an awful change. None of us like it, but we're stuck and
this is the only path forward short of completely abandoning
the use of the software builds on these branches.

Change-Id: Ia4434e9d2e4df49b26c33fcf371d821e0d44d6b7
(cherry picked from commit 68961df8d57bf9f3fda1d81bbf71bca87a462738)

commit_message:
CI: Get tinyipa build working for CI usage

The qemu git server has updated it's ssl certificate, and can no longer
be verified by the software libraries and embedded tinycore data for
the 10.x release. Unfortunately, we have CI hard coded to an older
release and we cannot release a newer, older version of the tinycore
10.x supporting packages.

So, for our CI purposes, we just need a working build, so that
is all this patch attempts to do, get our CI in a working state
for the older branches.

It is an awful change. None of us like it, but we're stuck and
this is the only path forward short of completely abandoning
the use of the software builds on these branches.

Change-Id: Ia4434e9d2e4df49b26c33fcf371d821e0d44d6b7

commit_message:
Add yoga bundles and release-tool syncs

* charm-helpers sync for classic charms
* sync from release-tools
* switch to release-specific zosci functional tests
* run focal-ussuri as smoke tests
* remove trusty, xenial, and groovy metadata/tests
* drop py35 and add py39

Change-Id: I1ee262ed68fdc64cdc5ef005c72087c0d83312cc

commit_message:
Enforces minimum Ceph client version to Mimic

This is so that we can take advantage of the deferred deletion
feature in Cinder.

Change-Id: I4c3d8fee6c7a0c25cca4d1e6b731060684cd28b3
Closes-Bug: 1914124

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- rebuild to pick up charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0
- remove voting groovy bundle

Change-Id: I9f0948311c21d754aabc867e5da4e6bd15534686

[{'created': '2021-11-09 15:27:37.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid handling a deploy failure twice

In some cases we handle the same exception twice in a row: in agent_base
and in deployments.do_next_deploy_step. This change avoids it.

Also make deploy step error messages more uniform across the board.

Change-Id: Ic84c04118b1a85b10a761fc58796827583a5b086
(cherry picked from commit 4f08938043a3d708478e9e293e5985c48a7f5e06)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid handling a deploy failure twice

In some cases we handle the same exception twice in a row: in agent_base
and in deployments.do_next_deploy_step. This change avoids it.

Also make deploy step error messages more uniform across the board.

Change-Id: Ic84c04118b1a85b10a761fc58796827583a5b086
(cherry picked from commit 4f08938043a3d708478e9e293e5985c48a7f5e06)

commit_message:
Add yoga bundles and release-tool syncs

* charm-helpers sync for classic charms
* sync from release-tools
* switch to release-specific zosci functional tests
* run focal-ussuri as smoke tests
* remove trusty, xenial, and groovy metadata/tests
* drop py35 and add py39

Change-Id: I484a23091ebaf2fea90e2d89c138208e03367137

commit_message:
Add yoga bundles and release-tool syncs

* charm-helpers sync for classic charms
* sync from release-tools
* switch to release-specific zosci functional tests
* run focal-ussuri as smoke tests
* remove trusty, xenial, and groovy metadata/tests
* drop py35 and add py39
* charms.ceph sync

Change-Id: I214c0517b223da5fce9e942269fd8703422d1a2b

commit_message:
Add yoga bundles and release-tool syncs

* charm-helpers sync for classic charms
* sync from release-tools
* switch to release-specific zosci functional tests
* run focal-ussuri as smoke tests
* remove trusty, xenial, and groovy metadata/tests
* drop py35 and add py39
* charms.ceph sync

Change-Id: I4d517c40a4450ef1395dd0240513eeebc069384c

subject: Fix timeout calc of nested resource groups
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-10 15:41:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix timeout calc of nested resource groups

The timeout calculation of nested resource groups are using seconds but
then it passing the value in seconds to the stack resource that is
expected it in minutes. This leads to a rapidly increasing timeout value
in each nesting levels.

This patch converts the seconds to minutes before passing it forward.

Story: 2009237
Task: 43372
Change-Id: I3f132d4889723f7b4a3a416779ac5ee7663249b8
(cherry picked from commit ef731bca05ea683c30448a2db397ae631c121d95)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix timeout calc of nested resource groups

The timeout calculation of nested resource groups are using seconds but
then it passing the value in seconds to the stack resource that is
expected it in minutes. This leads to a rapidly increasing timeout value
in each nesting levels.

This patch converts the seconds to minutes before passing it forward.

Story: 2009237
Task: 43372
Change-Id: I3f132d4889723f7b4a3a416779ac5ee7663249b8
(cherry picked from commit ef731bca05ea683c30448a2db397ae631c121d95)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 10:38:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "_sync_metadata_ports" with no DHCP subnets

When a subnet does not have DHCP configured, the metadata port does
not have an IP address on this CIDR. The method
"OvnNbSynchronizer.sync_networks_ports_and_dhcp_opts", was always
setting an IP address for the metadata ports, regardless of the subnet
configuration (with or without DHCP).

The method "_sync_metadata_ports", in charge of synchronizing the
metadata ports, now filters the subnets by the parameter "enable_dhcp".

In case of having a subnet with DHCP enabled, if the metadata port is
missing the subnet IP addresses, the method adds them.

In case of having a subnet without DHCP enabled, if the metadata port
has an IP address on the subnet, the method removes it.

Closes-Bug: #1939726

Neutron-master: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/811996

Change-Id: I09cc14dff6933aae63cbd43a29f9221f405ecede
'}, {'created': '2021-10-20 08:12:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "_sync_metadata_ports" with no DHCP subnets

not have an IP address on this CIDR. The method
"OvnNbSynchronizer.sync_networks_ports_and_dhcp_opts", was always
setting an IP address for the metadata ports, regardless of the subnet
configuration (with or without DHCP).

The method "_sync_metadata_ports", in charge of synchronizing the
metadata ports, now filters the subnets by the parameter "enable_dhcp".

In case of having a subnet with DHCP enabled, if the metadata port is

In case of having a subnet without DHCP enabled, if the metadata port

missing the subnet IP addresses, the method adds them.

In case of having a subnet without DHCP enabled, if the metadata port
has an IP address on the subnet, the method removes it.

Closes-Bug: #1939726

Neutron-master: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/811996

Change-Id: I09cc14dff6933aae63cbd43a29f9221f405ecede

"OvnNbSynchronizer.sync_networks_ports_and_dhcp_opts", was always

In case of having a subnet without DHCP enabled, if the metadata port

commit_message:
Fix "_sync_metadata_ports" with no DHCP subnets

When a subnet does not have DHCP configured, the metadata port does
not have an IP address on this CIDR. The method
"OvnNbSynchronizer.sync_networks_ports_and_dhcp_opts", was always
setting an IP address for the metadata ports, regardless of the subnet
configuration (with or without DHCP).

The method "_sync_metadata_ports", in charge of synchronizing the
metadata ports, now filters the subnets by the parameter "enable_dhcp".

In case of having a subnet with DHCP enabled, if the metadata port is
missing the subnet IP addresses, the method adds them.

In case of having a subnet without DHCP enabled, if the metadata port
has an IP address on the subnet, the method removes it.

NOTE: when moving this patch from Neutron to networking-ovn, [1] was
merged first. This patch implements the needed code to fix LP#1939726,
that was in the Neutron one [2]. That means the current patch only
includes the testing part (that should be included in the repository
to avoid regressions).

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-ovn/+/812714
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/811996

Closes-Bug: #1939726

Neutron-master: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/811996

Change-Id: I09cc14dff6933aae63cbd43a29f9221f405ecede

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1aba782faab9f3228c1770eab19a377026e0c006

commit_message:
tests: Enable SQLAlchemy 2.0 deprecation warnings

Well, sort of. We enable them but immediately filter out the ones we're
actually seeing, the rationale being that we can address these in a
piecemeal fashion without the risk of introducing new issues.

There's a lot more to be done here. However, the work done in oslo.db
[1] should provide a guide for how to resolve the outstanding issues.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%2522sqlalchemy-20%2522+project:openstack/oslo.db

Change-Id: Iafe726d3819031c357460fd131bb2bb58babb4e2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix networking-l2gw location

The goal of this commit is to remove the reference to
openstack/networking-l2gw to avoid zuul configuration error [1].

The usage of openstack/networking-l2gw is almost clean up by
commit 5eec1f8634f67cb6ebcb60229d7245a4e112d516 but I found
some remaining ones. This commit cleans up them so it is directly
proposed to stable/rocky.

* Move failing jobs to the experimental queue
* Run pep8 with python2.7
* Can bandit to install python2.7 compatible version
* Run requirements-check on ubuntu-bionic.
  Also adjust sphinx requirements to pass the job.
* Drop the releasenotes job because the releasenotes job is run against
  the master branch but the master branch of networking-midonet has been
  retired. Perhaps branch-override: stable/victoria would work, but
  considering the recent activity in networking-midonet, I did not try it.
* Add bindep.txt to fix unit tests.
  The unit tests fail since no mysqladmin command is installed, add
  bindep.txt to install the needed binaries in our CI environment.
  (cherry picked from commit 5a978840f0c9550b8fa51f84c67c5649caf0ae37)
* Skip test_router_add_gateway_notifications (cherry picked from commit
  44e1abcf1854f07982a530561c3291d171ce98ff in stable/stein)
* Remove neutron-lbaas references from .zuul.yaml

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-June/023321.html

Change-Id: I68cfb312e6b4bbc06db9f78abadd874aa813de05

This would fix the docs build failures with
sqlalchemy 1.4.27.

commit_message:
Release python-novaclient Ussuri 17.0.1

The only relevant patch in this release is a functional test related
patch. This is planned to be the final release before Ussuri branch
transitions to Extended Maintenance. For content see the list below:

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 17.0.0..HEAD
437d63de Add a cleanup for a server in a functional test
25afea2a Switch legacy Zuul jobs to native Zuul v3 jobs
694b95e3 Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
1d8a3753 Update .gitreview for stable/ussuri

Change-Id: Id38c2e2ed3b66e93b14f60e58de9962b3bf80455

messages:
[{'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2021-11-18 07:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-11-18 10:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/818337/1/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 58m 42s'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-18 07:00:07.000000000', 'message': 'Support legacy tap interface for OVS DPDK

In case of OVS DPDK, only vhostuser interface can
be supported currently, but this can work only if
VM uses hugepages, in some case, users perfer to
use KSM (Kernel Same-page Merging) to get much more
memory than pysical one, so tap interface is a good
choice because it can support vhost and OVS kernel
also uses it.

In addition, this also help live migrtae VM from OVS
kernel node to OVS DPDK node and vice versa (note:
only valid in non-hugepage case).

Signed-off-by: Yi Yang <yangyi01@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I32debe11b617d69fdae644f4e5da10c476defe61
'}]
commit_message:
Support legacy tap interface for OVS DPDK

In case of OVS DPDK, only vhostuser interface can
be supported currently, but this can work only if
VM uses hugepages, in some case, users perfer to
use KSM (Kernel Same-page Merging) to get much more
memory than pysical one, so tap interface is a good
choice because it can support vhost and OVS kernel
also uses it.

In addition, this also help live migrtae VM from OVS
kernel node to OVS DPDK node and vice versa (note:
only valid in non-hugepage case).

Signed-off-by: Yi Yang <yangyi01@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I32debe11b617d69fdae644f4e5da10c476defe61

Initial project commit

This commit provides Zuul logscraper tool responsible for
getting newest logs by using Zuul API and pushing them to
log processing services.

Change-Id: Iff45fbcb6d4813cc60dc705c60e95f3045984b5c

commit_message:
RBD: Open RBD images read-only where possible

In cases where we don't need to modify the image,
open rbd images in read-only mode.

Closes-Bug: #1947518
Change-Id: I8287460b902dd525aa5313861142f5fb8490e60a
(cherry picked from commit e644e3584b040823f3b3d9d73730b861a3ec413f)
(cherry picked from commit 5b169aeea76baecf0b6795efd09dfb1c58ff20d9)
(cherry picked from commit f2fe6cc115da08670e7aab39fc21b354ce55d3cd)
(cherry picked from commit 5379af08f0a821f6d4cf1571e83680d55e5c17b8)

commit_message:
Add "bochs" as a possible video model

In Xena, this commit[1] support for the "bochs" video model (the device
is recommended for UEFI guest), but neglected to update Glance
documentation.  Correct that now.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c590843974
    "Allow 'bochs' as a display device option"

Change-Id: I2026a81d3611e069fbcd1a79c2384d18cb5a653d
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-18 00:30:07.000000000', 'message': 'Enable H306 check and fix import ordering

To better align with other OpenStack projects and to reduce the
ongoing problem with duplicate imports, this patch re-enables the
H306 check for proper module import order.

Change-Id: Iced92590829f6d9177d64ad4868aebe6eafd6a8a
'}]
commit_message:
Enable H306 check and fix import ordering

To better align with other OpenStack projects and to reduce the
ongoing problem with duplicate imports, this patch re-enables the
H306 check for proper module import order.

Change-Id: Iced92590829f6d9177d64ad4868aebe6eafd6a8a

commit_message:
Add basic support for CertificateService

Adds the related data structures and enums, as well as support for
replacing certificates.

Change-Id: I4ea7f084334a9125c737d0d5f594f1f8c926f377

commit_message:
Add libcgroup related packages in bindep.txt

To use volume_copy_bps_limit option, libcgroup package is required.
This change adds cgroup-tools for dpkg based distros and libcgroup-tools
for rpm based distros.

Closes-Bug: #1931049
Change-Id: I179f23d3e6c62d02c069be0dd3d60968a2119568
(cherry picked from commit ca1e0bd76beafa20a2240260b1a5116b6ea6bfcd)
(cherry picked from commit ba4dc6f937821451e476a8e6bd2fcb01c21542e2)
(cherry picked from commit e2aad0ead12e58dda1eaf160d4273c94159633a8)

commit_message:
Migrate from testr to stestr

* Replace .testr.conf by .stestr.conf for migration and update
  .gitignore, tox.ini and test-requirements.txt files accordingly
* Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Signed-off-by: HeroicHitesh <email.hiteshkumar@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibeb39fd9293ad037b038857507eeb498856036e3

commit_message:
Disable ubi repos during container builds

When ubi is used to build the base image,
there is a ubi.repo file added. The rpms from
these repos can clash which rpms from
repos put down from CI.

This patch disables the ubi repos if
they exist to minimize clashes.

Change-Id: I6b05702b4ed17b99eb8246d6740dd74c0ebef758
Related-Bug: BZ2022749
(cherry picked from commit I6b05702b4ed17b99eb8246d6740dd74c0ebef758)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-08 19:23:10.000000000', 'message': "Add ping test for all networks gateway IPs

Add ping test for gateway IPs on all networks, to ensure
all gateways are reachable.

The releated Bugzilla reports an issue where some network
fabrics fail when using the current node ping test, which
pings the first node in each role. The fabric simply does
not forward traffic before the gateway has been pinged.

One can argue that the fabric in question is broken. However,
with the current implementation the first node in each role
actually ping tests only against it's own address? So adding
the test to ping the gateway addresses improves the validation
in general.

Related RHBZ#1875962
Depends-On: I93cded61ffb862e99fd8043dbf0def3d16079692

Change-Id: I3309f2a0e39ad115930ecd5c0e895816565819e9

Make PingTestGatewayIPsMap a map of flatten lists

PingTestGatewayIPsMap elements may contain list of lists, causing failures
on roles that iterate over them. See [1] and #1950528 for more info.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/817500

"}]
commit_message:
Add ping test for all networks gateway IPs

Add ping test for gateway IPs on all networks, to ensure
all gateways are reachable.

The releated Bugzilla reports an issue where some network
fabrics fail when using the current node ping test, which
pings the first node in each role. The fabric simply does
not forward traffic before the gateway has been pinged.

One can argue that the fabric in question is broken. However,
with the current implementation the first node in each role
actually ping tests only against it's own address? So adding
the test to ping the gateway addresses improves the validation
in general.

Make PingTestGatewayIPsMap a map of flatten lists

PingTestGatewayIPsMap elements may contain list of lists, causing failures
on roles that iterate over them. See [1] and #1950528 for more info.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/817500

Related RHBZ#1875962
Closes-bug: #1950528
Depends-On: I93cded61ffb862e99fd8043dbf0def3d16079692

Change-Id: I3309f2a0e39ad115930ecd5c0e895816565819e9
(cherry picked from commit 5d830980ec842c6093a8fd44ef922014bcadf693)
(cherry picked from commit efc328c66898bfc09c5dcb00fe5f584a45b899ff)

subject: Fix namespace-less containers in image-serve
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-11-10 22:21:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-11-17 21:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-10 22:21:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix namespace-less containers in image-serve

The build_catalog() function expects the manifests, tags and blobs be
available before the catalog will recognized a container image. The
previous spot where this function was called was after the manifests but
before the tags are created.  This causes the newly uploaded container
not to be listed in the catalog. This change moves the build_catalog()
to last so new images get correctly added to the catalog.

Change-Id: I3f08fe0efef1e830b034fab06574a05dff89ccc0
Closes-Bug: #1950352
(cherry picked from commit f8eeb0dd834ecd0faae05161cef4a38211894a7a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix namespace-less containers in image-serve

The build_catalog() function expects the manifests, tags and blobs be
available before the catalog will recognized a container image. The
previous spot where this function was called was after the manifests but
before the tags are created.  This causes the newly uploaded container
not to be listed in the catalog. This change moves the build_catalog()
to last so new images get correctly added to the catalog.

Change-Id: I3f08fe0efef1e830b034fab06574a05dff89ccc0
Closes-Bug: #1950352
(cherry picked from commit f8eeb0dd834ecd0faae05161cef4a38211894a7a)

commit_message:
Fix permissions for deployments

If you run the deployment without a global become, the permissions on
the deployment output folder is root which causes it to fail.

2021-10-25 17:21:12.735097 | 5254006a-0342-081e-9547-00000000043e |
FATAL | Template deployment file for ControllerSwapDeployment |
overcloud-controller-0 | error={"changed": false, "checksum":
"4b4902390aa26ccce0f06960450eeb7ba0b79735", "msg": "Destination
/var/lib/heat-config/tripleo-config-download not writable"}

Change-Id: I987e81fee3d25189dc001edd70bb57d5c3dd4310
(cherry picked from commit f9377d062bb4c9fe11c1e9698dcae614540dfb81)

commit_message:
Add ping test for all networks gateway IPs

Add ping test for gateway IPs on all networks, to ensure
all gateways are reachable.

The releated Bugzilla reports an issue where some network
fabrics fail when using the current node ping test, which
pings the first node in each role. The fabric simply does
not forward traffic before the gateway has been pinged.

One can argue that the fabric in question is broken. However,
with the current implementation the first node in each role
actually ping tests only against it's own address? So adding
the test to ping the gateway addresses improves the validation
in general.

Related RHBZ#1875962

Change-Id: I93cded61ffb862e99fd8043dbf0def3d16079692
(cherry picked from commit 70a37f4ec8b61c784aed051322aa0dfc84ebdfee)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-08 04:39:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix community image handling in launch instance form

Community images which are not owned by a focused project are not
included in the normal image list API (i.e., without specifying
"community" as visibility), so we need an extra call of the image
list API specifying "community" visibility in a filter.

It was originally fixed by [1] but was dropped in [2].
The main motivation of [2] is to address "Duplicates in a repeater
are not allowed" error in the JavaScript console.

The approach of [2] was to drop multiple glance API calls, but
the right solution would be to check duplicated images included
in both API calls. This situation with duplicated images happens
when a community image is owned by a focused project. In such case,
the community image is included in the responses of both API calls.

This commit adds a logic to check image IDs already processed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/614688
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/640762

Closes-Bug: #1914045
Related-Bug: #1779250
Related-Bug: #1818508

Change-Id: I2ed1b6064ddd6f62818d6112e98e5d5a98beae9d
(cherry picked from commit c9bb0e95eaa7ae4f0cce21bc0a246a9b0cd2f880)
'}, {'created': '2021-03-08 06:54:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix community image handling in launch instance form

when a community image is owned by a focused project. In such case,
the community image is included in the responses of both API calls.

This commit adds a logic to check image IDs already processed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/614688
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/640762

Closes-Bug: #1914045
Related-Bug: #1779250
Related-Bug: #1818508

Change-Id: I2ed1b6064ddd6f62818d6112e98e5d5a98beae9d
(cherry picked from commit c9bb0e95eaa7ae4f0cce21bc0a246a9b0cd2f880)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix community image handling in launch instance form

Community images which are not owned by a focused project are not
included in the normal image list API (i.e., without specifying
"community" as visibility), so we need an extra call of the image
list API specifying "community" visibility in a filter.

It was originally fixed by [1] but was dropped in [2].
The main motivation of [2] is to address "Duplicates in a repeater
are not allowed" error in the JavaScript console.

The approach of [2] was to drop multiple glance API calls, but
the right solution would be to check duplicated images included
in both API calls. This situation with duplicated images happens
when a community image is owned by a focused project. In such case,
the community image is included in the responses of both API calls.

This commit adds a logic to check image IDs already processed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/614688
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/640762

Closes-Bug: #1914045
Related-Bug: #1779250
Related-Bug: #1818508

Change-Id: I2ed1b6064ddd6f62818d6112e98e5d5a98beae9d
(cherry picked from commit c9bb0e95eaa7ae4f0cce21bc0a246a9b0cd2f880)

commit_message:
Fixed copy-on-write mode in GPFS NFS driver

IBM Spectrum Scale cinder driver (GPFS) support copy-on-write feature
in all the configuration. Resolving the bug mentioned below will
enable mmclone feature of the IBM Spectrum Scale filesystem to provide
better performance while configured in GPFS NFS mode.

Closes-Bug: #1947134
Closes-Bug: #1947123
Change-Id: I3e77c890c7abca85dab92500eae989b4dff9824d
(cherry picked from commit dcc191646985fa0be76ee763935ef37a8456d1e6)

commit_message:
Run keystone-ldap job on keystone changes

This change modifies the keystone-ldap job to run in check when
the keystone chart contains any modifications. This moves it from
running periodically to running on each keystone change.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm/+/816209

Change-Id: I32008e3a14b0428922071205f873087c2aba071d

commit_message:
Adding logging to file

It's important to support logging to a file for troubleshooting purpose.
It's also important to rotate this file as it might grow quite large
over time.

Also, creating a common module where we can move gradually functions
that are common to any other modules. We currently can't import utils
from sriov_config for example because utils is already importing
sriov_config. This leads to duplicate code which is harder to maintain.

Change-Id: Ieafc2adc0247efc47130cd5ea29c59a140feaf0c

commit_message:
Update periodic/experimental jobs to helm v3

This change updates the experimental jobs that are
currently working to use helm v3. Later changes should
fix the other issues that they are currently experiencing.

commit_message:
Override default mkisofs_cmd in CentOS 9.

In [1] the parameter mkisofs_cmd was introduced in puppet-nova to set
this parameter as CentOS Stream 9 requires a different value that the
default one.

This change overrides the default value in CentOS9 so that no
additional tuning is needed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/810932

commit_message:
Deprecate ineffective MysqlIncreaseFileLimit

This parameter enables the systemd drop-in for mariadb.service but
the service has never used since all services were containerized.

Change-Id: I88e5f7c13861729c464a8ba88b5ca2c090597d93

commit_message:
Add additional project personas for secure RBAC

This commit formalizes some additional users to act as different project
users and updates clouds.yaml file so they're easy to use.

It creates:

  - a reader on the demo project
  - a reader on the alt_demo project
  - a member on the alt_demo project

With the adoption of secure RBAC personas, these are useful for using
OpenStack APIs as that work continues.

Change-Id: I3237a771275311377313b7d7d80ac059ac69d031

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I18820238e370fbd0836995a281b607da90871ef6

commit_message:
Migrate from testr to stestr

* Replace .testr.conf by .stestr.conf for migration and update
  .gitignore and test-requirements.txt file accordingly
* Use 3.18.0 as the minversion for tox

Change-Id: I6a95687369ab4f37d54db5c64d436b0a18b76683

commit_message:
Add release notes command to tox

Added command "tox -e newnote slug-goes-here" to create a new release note.
Fixes error that occurs when reno is not installed globally.
Also changed contributor documentation to include this new command.

Change-Id: I4568163d63e389891e701a424720567d065f70b3

This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

commit_message:
Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

commit_message:
Complete openstackid repo retirements

This removes the repos from zuul main.yaml and gerritbot. It updates our
Gerrit acls to mark the repos read only and updates the project
descriptions to be explicit about the retirement.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openinfra/openstackid/+/818171
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openinfra/openstackid-resources/+/818174
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/puppet-openstackid/+/818172
Change-Id: Ibb05d4030c7b8eb416898e7e941fb77b7531c3db

Add Local IP Extension and DB

This adds Local IP API extension, DB and OVO models, DB mixin,
migration and service plugin.

Partial-Bug: #1930200

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-29 07:32:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix default amphora output filename in diskimage-create

The default amphora image output filename (AMP_OUTPUTFILENAME) doesn't
include the extension, as DIB may add it automatically.
But later in the diskimage-create.sh script, we run 'stat' on
AMP_OUTPUTFILENAME, and it can only work with the real filename.

Change-Id: Iabc2f613d1afbfac414d9e98cbd147467bceda73
"}]
commit_message:
Fix default amphora output filename in diskimage-create

The default amphora image output filename (AMP_OUTPUTFILENAME) doesn't
include the extension, as DIB may add it automatically.
But later in the diskimage-create.sh script, we run 'stat' on
AMP_OUTPUTFILENAME, and it can only work with the real filename.

Change-Id: Iabc2f613d1afbfac414d9e98cbd147467bceda73

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-16 10:21:38.000000000', 'message': 'Revert to eventlet < 0.32.0 and dnspython < 2.0.0

The new eventlet breaks, among other things, the Ironic ramdisk:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/736

Since eventlet is only compatible with dnspython 2.0.0+ starting with
0.32.0, cap dnspython again.

Change-Id: I8f4c2244ae93f0e7626f8ef88a7dfed1c943ba08
'}, {'created': '2021-11-17 10:58:27.000000000', 'message': 'Blacklist eventlet 0.32.0, jump to 0.33.0

The new eventlet breaks, among other things, the Ironic ramdisk:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/736

Change-Id: I8f4c2244ae93f0e7626f8ef88a7dfed1c943ba08
'}]
commit_message:
Blacklist eventlet 0.32.0, jump to 0.33.0

The new eventlet breaks, among other things, the Ironic ramdisk:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/736

Change-Id: I8f4c2244ae93f0e7626f8ef88a7dfed1c943ba08

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-14 13:19:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional and fullstack jobs with FIPS enabled

This patch adds definition of the functional and fullstack jobs
with enabled support for FIPS [1].
Jobs are based on the Centos 8 stream as this disto allows to enable
FIPS support.
Jobs are added to the experimental queue for now.

This patch also makes some changes in the bindep and
configure_functional_tests role to make functional/fullstack tests
working on the Centos.

[1] https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/fips/140/3/final

Co-Authored-By: Ade Lee <alee@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I582495826155740ad2660ee2a8717696b0393d26

commit_message:
Add functional and fullstack jobs with FIPS enabled

This patch adds definition of the functional and fullstack jobs
with enabled support for FIPS [1].
Jobs are based on the Centos 8 stream as this disto allows to enable
FIPS support.
Jobs are added to the experimental queue for now.

This patch also makes some changes in the bindep and
configure_functional_tests role to make functional/fullstack tests
working on the Centos.

[1] https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/fips/140/3/final

Co-Authored-By: Ade Lee <alee@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I582495826155740ad2660ee2a8717696b0393d26

Add Neutron doc for the Guaranteed Minimum Packet Rate feature.

Add functional tests for ECMP routes

Adding ECMP routes, where the destination is the same for multiple
routes available since [0].
One DVR test was merged with it, and this patch aims to cover other
l3 setups: legacy and HA.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/743661

[{'created': '2021-11-16 14:15:40.000000000', 'message': 'Disable ubi repos during container builds

When ubi is used to build the base image,
there is a ubi.repo file added. The rpms from
these repos can clash which rpms from
repos put down from CI.

This patch disables the ubi repos if
they exist to minimize clashes.

Change-Id: I6b05702b4ed17b99eb8246d6740dd74c0ebef758
Related-Bug: BZ2022749
'}]
commit_message:
Disable ubi repos during container builds

When ubi is used to build the base image,
there is a ubi.repo file added. The rpms from
these repos can clash which rpms from
repos put down from CI.

This patch disables the ubi repos if
they exist to minimize clashes.

Change-Id: I6b05702b4ed17b99eb8246d6740dd74c0ebef758
Related-Bug: BZ2022749

commit_message:
Fix UEFI record regex

I accidently put colons on the test data and remembered taking the
colon character out of the regex I was working on, but apparently
left it in, and accounted for the active entry indicator flag
which appears to have inconsistent support across vendors.

The regex has been fixed, and a test added from a Lenovo SR650
which has some additional string entry data in the UEFI output
which may separate entries.

Change-Id: I1f67b0fb1f645fa82e98bd7c7bba3ffc7755cc74
(cherry picked from commit e10f052c06c03016b0ff4d9c1f3191c79fc50a1a)

commit_message:
Remove unused tripleo::profile::base::validations

This was used by instack-undercloud which was retired during the Rocky
cycle. The same is now implemented by tripleo-ansible and the remaining
implementation is unused.

Change-Id: I9b83f8d337883cc260d6819e96439cc19700134f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-16 10:12:19.000000000', 'message': '[Neutron] Add custom env file to set dns_domain_name

To be able to run properly dns_domain_name related tests from the
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_ports module, Neutron has to have
configured non default dns_domain_name option.
This patch adds custom environment file which will set that config
option to "openstackgate.local" which is the same value like is configured
in all of the Neutron CI jobs by the Neutron Devstack plugin.

Related-Bug: #1950815
Change-Id: I4d803a7b43533debdf6063299878cf1b13c664e6
'}]
commit_message:
[Neutron] Add custom env file to set dns_domain_name

To be able to run properly dns_domain_name related tests from the
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_ports module, Neutron has to have
configured non default dns_domain_name option.
This patch adds custom environment file which will set that config
option to "openstackgate.local" which is the same value like is configured
in all of the Neutron CI jobs by the Neutron Devstack plugin.

Related-Bug: #1950815
Change-Id: I4d803a7b43533debdf6063299878cf1b13c664e6

subject: Make PingTestGatewayIPsMap a map of flatten lists
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-12 15:17:14.000000000', 'message': 'Make PingTestGatewayIPsMap a map of flatten lists

PingTestGatewayIPsMap elements may contain list of lists, causing failures
on roles that iterate over them. See [1] and #1950528 for more info.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/817500

Closes-bug: #1950528
Change-Id: Idb70c822f01f808871a53689edfa2edf52e59e54
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Make PingTestGatewayIPsMap a map of flatten lists

PingTestGatewayIPsMap elements may contain list of lists, causing failures
on roles that iterate over them. See [1] and #1950528 for more info.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/817500

Closes-bug: #1950528
Change-Id: Idb70c822f01f808871a53689edfa2edf52e59e54
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add ovn-monitor-all option to ovn-controller

With monitor-all option, all ovn-controllers
do not enable conditional monitoring there
by reducing the load on the Southbound ovsdb-server.

Conflicts:
	manifests/controller.pp

(wallaby -> victoria)
Conflicts:
	manifests/controller.pp

Resolved conflict caused by c60fdb9540bc5dfc60cf05d56ad9d8fe45164343

(victoria -> ususri)
Conflicts:
	spec/classes/ovn_controller_spec.rb

Resolved conflict caused by dba349dad01edafab4a3fda3b9ad813cce814597

Partial-Bug: #1936781
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia78c0873e7ac6488b3048ae8475cc87ec40022bb
(cherry picked from commit 7a1bb545198d8c864c619b30f4bc13417d764bbd)
(cherry picked from commit 9879556556e9cb2bc9139799e93da5feb60124b3)

commit_message:
WIP: CI: remove tinycore as 10.x can no longer build

It appears tinycore10 must no longer have valid certificates for
newer https certificates issueed, such as the one for git.qemu.org.

Change-Id: I54411fb0ffbac80b94717d23282b6f9a49c22e8a

commit_message:
WIP. Do Not Merge

Set CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS to use 2 LVM backends as the default.
This will allow testing of in-flight tempest patches that require
2 Cinder Backends:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326681/
Migrate volume while attached to an instance

Depends-On: I4ed9b1f30d4e4e595c44a0ce243c2463069833d7
Change-Id: Ie8bd0fba1023691246b788b2a0d12ddf3d1b604f

commit_message:
Wire up centos9 master buildimage jobs for check and gate

The job definitions are added at [1] and the new
single-centos-9-node nodeset is added in the parent at [2]

Also fixes issue with the 'release' var which is not present
in the check/gate version of these jobs so we try to discover
it using the relevant build-containers tasks.

This also disables the image_sanity check for overcloud-full
because of related-bug.

Finally adds wallaby to the branches negative match for c9
build jobs as we aren't ready for W yet.

Related-Bug: 1950453

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/813618
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/816821

Change-Id: I5c78c975afa3efb2c478339cacd006e064b24e71

commit_message:
Fix validation of memcache_security_strategy

Currently the memcache_security_strategy parameter can be set to only
MAC or ENCRYPT, but None should be also acceptable. In addition,
the parameter ignores case thus we should not require a specific
case pattern.

Change-Id: I8779d07152b540def0981620cd1c707fe32cd7b0

commit_message:
Fix module name in load_logging function

After refactoring the log function to tripleo-repos utils[1], the module
name 'tripleo-get-hash' become hardcoded in load_logging function.
Now, this function accepts the module name as parameter.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-repos/+/815991

Change-Id: I6840870cf5b55ee1d47e3634009f1c5ec7045b6f
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow to store qcow in partitioned archive

Partitioned image may be stored in qcow2 format. This patch adds
support for such images.

Change-Id: I1b9db1b11509d0b35501954d5c0f7cce34d9bc78

commit_message:
Fixing install scripts to allow USE_SSL to work

When using the USE_SSL=true option on local.conf, stack.sh fails due
to the certificate being created with "localhost" hostname. This patch
makes the openssl use SERVICE_HOSTNAME instead when it's provided.

Change-Id: I67c7c640d97b99baddb0a531c5ff64ec97c52510

Why should I check for CEPH_CONTAINERIZED? If CEPH_CONTAINERIZED is false then DOCKER_EXEC is empty, which is harmless. If I check for CEPH_CONTAINERIZED I'd have to add if/else statements which seems to be overkill to me."}, {'account_id': 6984, 'date': '2016-10-30 19:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4656, 'date': '2016-11-01 15:42:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

But what if someone sets CEPH_CONTAINERIZED=False ?

Based on the code, it doesn't seem like this case is handled??"}, {'account_id': 4656, 'date': '2016-11-01 15:45:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So, basically you introduce this variable DOCKER_EXEC which is empty by default - and only clever people who _know_ about this variable (which I will note, is _not_ documented anywhere in the code, or in our configuration.rst), and then your commit message discusses a variable CEPH_CONTAINERIZED - which is never used anywhere in the code?'}, {'account_id': 4656, 'date': '2016-11-01 15:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 6984, 'date': '2016-11-16 15:08:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6984, 'date': '2016-11-16 15:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Sean, I added more context into the code, are you fine with this?
Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 4656, 'date': '2016-11-16 16:30:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No, if anything I am more concerned about this patch, since it now makes DevStack depend on a plugin for these variables that you are using. Just because they are empty or unset doesn't make it OK."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-16 18:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add support for containerized ceph

This commit is a follow up of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/374825/
which introduced the support to containerized Ceph.
If CEPH_CONTAINERIZED=True, to apply the approprieate changes
into Ceph we need to access the Docker container.
Usually DOCKER_EXEC variable contains: "docker exec ceph-demo" which
then connect inside the container and run the desired command. If the
variable is empty this won't break existing configuration.

Change-Id: I24a1fc4fb65cf9770b664539db013c8311c2ca5f
Signed-off-by: Sébastien Han <seb@redhat.com>

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Add Storwize as the cinder back-end driver

This patch implements configure_cinder_backend_storwize for
the Storwize driver.

Change-Id: Ia70f36855eb3d68708e17ab98ee1966565f4d0b2
Closes-Bug: #1468617

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-04 02:54:48.000000000', 'message': "Move local.conf creation to last minute

There may be situations where you'd like to do, essentially

 include_role:
   name: run-devstack
   vars:
     devstack_localrc:
       VARIABLE: {{ value }}

However if the local.conf has already been written out, this never
applies.  There doesn't seem to be any reason to not do this at the
very last moment, just before devstack runs, to give maximum
flexibility in adding values.  Move from the pre.yaml to be included
from the run-devstack role directly.

Change-Id: Id6731c5610d09d68e7d35f9b7b84909b2168ef26
"}, {'created': '2019-02-04 06:39:00.000000000', 'message': "Move local.conf creation to last minute

from the run-devstack role directly.

However if the local.conf has already been written out, this never

very last moment, just before devstack runs, to give maximum
flexibility in adding values.  Move from the pre.yaml to be included
from the run-devstack role directly.

Change-Id: Id6731c5610d09d68e7d35f9b7b84909b2168ef26
"}, {'created': '2019-02-05 08:24:20.000000000', 'message': 'Move local.conf creation to run-devstack role

There may be situations where you'd like to include variables into
devstack's local.conf provided at runtime, rather than inserted
statically in the job: definition.

The first thing required facilitate this is to move writing of the
local.conf from the pre.yaml playbook to be the run-devstack role.
This gives users of the run-devstack role a chance to run things
before the local.conf is actually written out.

The first thought is that the devstack_localrc variable can then be
modified (have keys appended to, etc.) at runtime.  This raises a bit
of a chicken-egg problem with variables, however.  The "local_mtu" and
"external_bridge_mtu" variables might be used in a job's definition of
devstack_localrc which Zuul constructs.  These are "dangling" as it
were; for example a role can not append to the Zuul constructed
devstack_localrc dictionary because that involves expanding the
missing variables.  Even if you have at a random point:

 - debug:
    var: devstack_localrc

You'll get:

 VARIABLE IS NOT DEFINED!: 'external_bridge_mtu' is undefined

We could move the variable definitions into a separate role that users
of run-devstack would have to know to run *before* they try to modify
devstack_localrc, but this is getting needlessly complex.  Thus we
introduce a new argument "devstack_localrc_extra" to run-devstack to
pass an arbitrary dictionary of keys.

Thus the final situation to set a variable dynamically looks something
like:

 - import_role:
     name: foo
  # ^ does magic and sets variable foo_bar, which we want devstack to see

 - import_role
     name: run-devstack
   vars:
     devstack_localrc_extra:
       FOO: "\{\{ foo_bar \}\}"

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/634366
Change-Id: Id6731c5610d09d68e7d35f9b7b84909b2168ef26
'}]
commit_message:
Move local.conf creation to run-devstack role

There may be situations where you'd like to include variables into
devstack's local.conf provided at runtime, rather than inserted
statically in the job: definition.

The first thing required facilitate this is to move writing of the
local.conf from the pre.yaml playbook to be the run-devstack role.
This gives users of the run-devstack role a chance to run things
before the local.conf is actually written out.

The first thought is that the devstack_localrc variable can then be
modified (have keys appended to, etc.) at runtime.  This raises a bit
of a chicken-egg problem with variables, however.  The "local_mtu" and
"external_bridge_mtu" variables might be used in a job's definition of
devstack_localrc which Zuul constructs.  These are "dangling" as it
were; for example a role can not append to the Zuul constructed
devstack_localrc dictionary because that involves expanding the
missing variables.  Even if you have at a random point:

 - debug:
    var: devstack_localrc

You'll get:

 VARIABLE IS NOT DEFINED!: 'external_bridge_mtu' is undefined

We could move the variable definitions into a separate role that users
of run-devstack would have to know to run *before* they try to modify
devstack_localrc, but this is getting needlessly complex.  Thus we
introduce a new argument "devstack_localrc_extra" to run-devstack to
pass an arbitrary dictionary of keys.

Thus the final situation to set a variable dynamically looks something
like:

 - import_role:
     name: foo
  # ^ does magic and sets variable foo_bar, which we want devstack to see

 - import_role
     name: run-devstack
   vars:
     devstack_localrc_extra:
       FOO: "\{\{ foo_bar \}\}"

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/634366
Change-Id: Id6731c5610d09d68e7d35f9b7b84909b2168ef26

commit_message:
uwsgi: don't enable python plugin

When uwsgi is installed by pip, python language support
is already built-in. So there is no need to enable it
throught plugin. Otherwise following error appears in log:

./python_plugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Closes-Bug: #1684501
Change-Id: I12ea857db4bbe525986ea80280311e26732579ba
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

commit_message:
[networking-midonet]: transition pike, queens and rocky to eol

This patch transitions stble/pike, stable/queens stable/rocky branches
to End of Life. This was discussed on Neutron CI meeting (see [1]) and
a mail was sent out to the community (see [2]).
These branches cannot be used anymore and will be deleted if this patch
merges.

[1]: https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-neutron/%23openstack-neutron.2021-09-07.log.html#t2021-09-07T15:18:43
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-September/024915.html

Change-Id: I54731ce492e6ffa5306050a2128c05cfeacc4e99

commit_message:
Fix an issue with Adjutant's Invite process not checking inherited roles

Adjutant's InviteUser action was not correctly checking inherited roles
which might allow someone to invite/create another user with roles outside
of those they inviting user can manage.

Change-Id: I1f45da4ce5ee6d1295a17767c432875c23106b15
Story: #2009326
(cherry picked from commit ab7f8115d45de5eb4ea76eda0996a559f6b4b508)

In the _process_added_router() method of the L3 agent, if processing
router will fail, router_info should be cleaned to e.g. be removed from
the router cache so it will not be treated as updated router in next
iteration of the agent.

Closes-Bug: #1947993
Change-Id: Ic0bc3d951d32efadc116708bfe518a711730429d
(cherry picked from commit 41159bd9a4178a5f8a4fdc90b034c48fa9880cac)
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup router for which processing added router failed

In the _process_added_router() method of the L3 agent, if processing
router will fail, router_info should be cleaned to e.g. be removed from
the router cache so it will not be treated as updated router in next
iteration of the agent.

Closes-Bug: #1947993
Change-Id: Ic0bc3d951d32efadc116708bfe518a711730429d
(cherry picked from commit 41159bd9a4178a5f8a4fdc90b034c48fa9880cac)

configuration option passed via oslo.config and adds it as an argument
to be passed to the selected oslo.cache backend.

subject: Delete log entries when SG or port is deleted
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-25 13:38:39.000000000', 'message': 'Delete log entries when SG or port is deleted

NOTE: this patch is an ammend of [1].

When a SG or a port is deleted, the related log entry should be
too. A log entry has the following fields:
- log.resource_id = SG ID
- log.target_id = port ID

[1] was deleting all log entries, related or not with the SG ID
deleted. This is because "get_logs_bound_sg" returned all log entries,
including those ones without any "resource_id" or "target_id".

Now this method can return only the log entries related to a port or
a SG, excluding those ones without those two parameters populated.

Closes-Bug: #1939558

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/804237

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/services/logapi/test_logging_plugin.py

Change-Id: Icb92327a06486e168ce064532d819347e6031cc1
(cherry picked from commit 41f78c678bcc164cd77ed7302bacf086d24ab28c)
(cherry picked from commit 2c4ab468ae53533db236809afaf0dd5f593db4dc)
(cherry picked from commit d5fd9f035ac38dde75e5cf89a062387d4d5512fc)

(cherry picked from commit 226367eed1148c6e555dcb8087f11b1f85a8eddc)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete log entries when SG or port is deleted

NOTE: this patch is an ammend of [1].

When a SG or a port is deleted, the related log entry should be
too. A log entry has the following fields:
- log.resource_id = SG ID
- log.target_id = port ID

[1] was deleting all log entries, related or not with the SG ID
deleted. This is because "get_logs_bound_sg" returned all log entries,
including those ones without any "resource_id" or "target_id".

Now this method can return only the log entries related to a port or
a SG, excluding those ones without those two parameters populated.

Closes-Bug: #1939558

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/804237

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/services/logapi/test_logging_plugin.py

Change-Id: Icb92327a06486e168ce064532d819347e6031cc1
(cherry picked from commit 41f78c678bcc164cd77ed7302bacf086d24ab28c)
(cherry picked from commit 2c4ab468ae53533db236809afaf0dd5f593db4dc)
(cherry picked from commit d5fd9f035ac38dde75e5cf89a062387d4d5512fc)
(cherry picked from commit 7790cecfc8c324780f8e5031bc59cb3d1a3c5f7c)
(cherry picked from commit 226367eed1148c6e555dcb8087f11b1f85a8eddc)

commit_message:
Delete SG log entries when SG is deleted

When security group is deleted, log entries configured for that SG
weren't removed and stayed in the DB as orphaned entries.
That patch fixes that by subscribe logapi service plugin to the
AFTER_DELETE security group events.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/services/logapi/test_logging_plugin.py

Closes-bug: #1939558
Change-Id: Ibffbbd3b529c31372715d9a064f7cb6bada8c424
(cherry picked from commit 7f063223553a18345891bf42e88989edb67038e7)
(cherry picked from commit 9d6aaff9a17f2b675e0f8bd0c2bf7ca665f8ee04)

commit_message:
Add missing packages to test dependencies

The tests are failing when running on Centos due to lack of
qemu-img package and python3-devel.
This patch is adding the missing packages to bindep.txt.

Closes-Bug: #1947146

Change-Id: I99ab96a7f8b6fdf6a27faf1fe0ea0328f89b154f

Infra VMs: fix some playbook host patterns

The infra-vms group was not added to some playbook host patterns where
it should have been. This change fixes that.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Refactor set_argument_parser to fix shell regression

Openstack Client and Validation Shell is hitting a regression
due to set_argument_parser calling directly parse_known_args
from argparse.
This patch fix the regression and avoid the need to call
parse_known_args directly.

Closes-Bug: #1949596
Change-Id: Ic9a682e7c3d5431e8779064947bd379c00aba584
