commit_message:
Do not use whole-disk images on libvirt environments

Some quickstart development will be required for libvirt environments
around fetching/uploading the correct image and supporting
overcloud_as_undercloud when the default overcloud image is
overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.qcow2.

Now that the default on master is whole_disk_images:true, this change
sets it to false for libvirt environments so they continue to work
with overcloud-full for now.

Change-Id: I1affd48fc450250360d4eae8b30d18330a49739d
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Closes-Bug: #1950383
Closes-Bug: #1948001

subject: Enforce existing roles and playbooks checks
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-15 18:43:21.000000000', 'message': "Enforce existing roles and playbooks checks

This patch enforces the roles and playbooks checks when creating a new
community validation by checking first if the ANSIBLE_ROLES_DIR and
ANSIBLE_VALIDATION_DIR are existing in the host.

It avoids getting error message like:

[Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/usr/share/ansible/roles'

when validations-common and tripleo-validations are not installed.

Change-Id: I6facca59c2ca9db2b5b1e7905ad8c9be68fff0b4
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-11-16 14:22:50.000000000', 'message': "Enforce existing roles and playbooks checks

This patch enforces the roles and playbooks checks when creating a new
community validation by checking first if the ANSIBLE_ROLES_DIR and
ANSIBLE_VALIDATION_DIR are existing in the host.

It avoids getting error message like:
  - [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/usr/share/ansible/roles'
when validations-common and tripleo-validations are not installed.

It also adjusts the unittests in order to avoid leaving leftovers such
as community-validations directory during the test execution.

Change-Id: I6facca59c2ca9db2b5b1e7905ad8c9be68fff0b4
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce existing roles and playbooks checks

This patch enforces the roles and playbooks checks when creating a new
community validation by checking first if the ANSIBLE_ROLES_DIR and
ANSIBLE_VALIDATION_DIR are existing in the host.

It avoids getting error message like:
  - [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/usr/share/ansible/roles'
when validations-common and tripleo-validations are not installed.

It also adjusts the unittests in order to avoid leaving leftovers such
as community-validations directory during the test execution.

Change-Id: I6facca59c2ca9db2b5b1e7905ad8c9be68fff0b4
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
bnr Configure ReaR to restore with ironic

This playbook configure Rear on the overcloud controllers
to do the restoration with PXE and use the undercloud ironic.

The data will be backed up on the tripleo_backup_and_restore_server

Change-Id: I958439e017efa45f316750a61fd7dfdee5afdc8e
(cherry picked from commit 0ecaf57cdc08b699a146808a4cd546794167791c)

commit_message:
Reduce the number of small functions in pxe_utils

This module contains a lot of trivial single-line functions that make
reading it unnecessarily complicated. This change removes some of them.

Change-Id: Ie26c011b5ed3cb406c5cc4e2f50bbbf622d3a8c8

commit_message:
Fix neutron intergration testing

We need to explicitly use the job for wallaby, since
neutron-tempest-plugin is branchless and new features were added in xena
that do not work with older neutron.

Change-Id: I6143003b8054337eadf7448426fec88559c00961

commit_message:
Move manage_uefi from the image extension to a public location

This call is very useful for custom deploy implementations, such as one
we maintain for OpenShift. Splitting it out also makes image.py slightly
more manageable.

The get_partition call is moved to partition_utils.

Change-Id: I60a6a2823d3eb27a4ae78e913e3655dae7b54ffe

commit_message:
Don't enforce scopes in the API policies UT temporary

There is bug in oslo_policy [1] that caused issues with enforcing
scopes properly for rules which inherits from the oslo_policy.BaseCheck
class (many of Neutron rules are done like that).
Now when fix [2] will be merged in oslo_policy we will need to change
expected exception type in some of the policies UT from
PolicyNotAuthorized to InvalidScope.
For now, to make it working with both old and new oslo_policy, let's
disable enforcing scopes in those UT. It will be enabled again when new
oslo_policy will be fixed and we will us it in Neutron.

[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1923503
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.policy/+/804980

Related-Bug: #1923503
Change-Id: I5c64eb9315b37379b0899c9d35f2f0d96f9c1579

commit_message:
Check interface presence in new namespace

When an interface is moved to a new namespace, specially with OVS
internal ports, the interface first dissapears from any network
namespace and then is added again. ovs-vswitchd service detects
this interface change as reported in [1]. This delay is the cause
of the related bug, where some interfaces are not present when
the L3 agent needs to manipulate them.

[1]https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1948832/comments/3

Closes-Bug: #1948832
Change-Id: I3af4d0afa784899689ccb595ce6ba64495431eb9

commit_message:
Add support for polling Radosgw metrics

Ceilometer supports polling metrics from the Radosgw service using
radosgw.* pollsters. This change introduces support for the parameters
required to use that feature.

Change-Id: I58be60247bba1483f49f830802d422109ff13930
(cherry picked from commit 7fbd758d72d347c66f3431fc6ed475266b263081)

Configure placement credentials for segments plugin

Call configure_placement_neutron to fill all the placement related
settings in neutron.conf if segments service plugin is enabled.

This commit adds possibility to use a host folder instead of
a volume by Gnocchi services. Operators can mount the folder
to an NFS share and provide HA for Gnocchi file backend. If user
does not configure Ceph or does not use host mounted NFS share
Gnocchi will only run on first controller - this helps to avoid
situations when metrics and statistics are split among multiple
nodes and queries return erroneous results.

Parially implements: blueprint gnocchi-nfs-backend

commit_message:
Add possibility to use shared storage for file backend in Gnocchi

This commit adds possibility to use a host folder instead of
a volume by Gnocchi services. Operators can mount the folder
to an NFS share and provide HA for Gnocchi file backend. If user
does not configure Ceph or does not use host mounted NFS share
Gnocchi will only run on first controller - this helps to avoid
situations when metrics and statistics are split among multiple
nodes and queries return erroneous results.

Partially implements: blueprint gnocchi-nfs-backend

Change-Id: I734b69088f7260ed030ae3bcb5be9a4aa97d6e70

In 1ctlr.yml[1] we are generating HostnameMap with quickstart interface,
which allow creation of HostnameMap with correct entry.

Following same pattern for 1ctlr_1comp.yml to avoid issue as mentioned in Closes-bug.

commit_message:
Generate HostnameMap with quickstart interface

In 1ctlr.yml[1] we are generating HostnameMap with quickstart interface,
which allow creation of HostnameMap with correct entry.

Following same pattern for 1ctlr_1comp.yml to avoid issue as mentioned in Closes-bug.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/branch/master/config/nodes/1ctlr.yml#L6

Closes-bug: #1950171
Change-Id: I6572eaefbb6033c61111c50fba3cec47b55a55de

after networking-midonet is retired.

This is causing the zuul configuration error on stable/train
gate.

Example: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/816597

NOTE: configuration error only happens when there is a change in
zuul.yaml file otherwise zuul just skip to run the non-defined jobs

Change-Id: Id996d0d6731ace2768c0ad10abad1adb565a77ae
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Remove non-existing networking-midonet job

networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-centos-7 is not defined
after networking-midonet is retired.

This is causing the zuul configuration error on stable/train
gate.

Example: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/816597

NOTE: configuration error only happens when there is a change in
zuul.yaml file otherwise zuul just skip to run the non-defined jobs

Change-Id: Id996d0d6731ace2768c0ad10abad1adb565a77ae

commit_message:
Replace "tenant_id" with "project_id" in OVO base

This is part of the remaining technical debt of the specs
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/moving-to-keystone-v3.html

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/keystone-v3

Change-Id: I714d97449c41c9dd889d1842c0fa9b78ffa0f9f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-31 15:38:42.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - QoS should not be set on parent storage group

The parent storage group is just a hold all for the child
storage groups which contain attributes like service level and QoS.
Setting QoS on the parent storage group can cause problems as
having a higher I/O limit on the child than the parent is not
allowed and this is not the intention.  The fix is to set
QoS on the child storage groups only.

Closes-Bug: #1930290
Change-Id: Ib2c1a44086da1fa3c64611344221c9307be22296
'}]
commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - QoS should not be set on parent storage group

The parent storage group is just a hold all for the child
storage groups which contain attributes like service level and QoS.
Setting QoS on the parent storage group can cause problems as
having a higher I/O limit on the child than the parent is not
allowed and this is not the intention.  The fix is to set
QoS on the child storage groups only.

Closes-Bug: #1930290
Change-Id: Ib2c1a44086da1fa3c64611344221c9307be22296

commit_message:
Cleanup router for which processing added router failed

In the _process_added_router() method of the L3 agent, if processing
router will fail, router_info should be cleaned to e.g. be removed from
the router cache so it will not be treated as updated router in next
iteration of the agent.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/agent.py

Closes-Bug: #1947993
Change-Id: Ic0bc3d951d32efadc116708bfe518a711730429d
(cherry picked from commit 41159bd9a4178a5f8a4fdc90b034c48fa9880cac)
(cherry picked from commit 1c17019f6c7957c95b1d12942c5898fcc111e4ab)

If a group snapshot did not exist on the array, an exception
was thrown which prevented its deletion from OpenStack.  This
fix checks for is existance and if it doesn't, removes it
gracefully.

Change-Id: Ibafdd77f7925ec400f8f8c4052826f55b1721eaa
"}]
commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Fix for group snapshot deletion

If a group snapshot did not exist on the array, an exception
was thrown which prevented its deletion from OpenStack.  This
fix checks for is existance and if it doesn't, removes it
gracefully.

Change-Id: Ibafdd77f7925ec400f8f8c4052826f55b1721eaa

'}, {'created': '2021-10-22 08:23:14.000000000', 'message': "Add Spinx RTD theme

The RTD theme [1] is being used by x/tobiko [2] project
to generate its documentation page [3]

[1] https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme
[2] https://opendev.org/x/tobiko
[3] https://tobiko.readthedocs.io

- Is the library actively maintained?
  It is. On Sep 21th we had the last release (1.0.0)
  There are many recent commits on master branch:
    https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme/commits/master

- Is the library good code?
  This is a widely used sphinx plugin used to generate
  many documentation pages. It has been working without
  any problem to generate Tobiko doc page since years:

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  It is:
    https://sphinx-rtd-theme.readthedocs.io/en/stable/development.html#supported-dependencies

- Is the library license compatible?
  It is being distributed under The MIT License:
    https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme/blob/master/LICENSE

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
  It is:
    https://packages.ubuntu.com/hirsute/all/sphinx-rtd-theme-common
    https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/python-sphinx_rtd_theme

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
  The default OpenStack Sphinx theme is not allowed to be used by non ufficial openstack projects
  Therefore Tobiko switch to use the RTD one that is the one provided by the same page where
  Tobiko's documentation is hosted:
    https://tobiko.readthedocs.io/

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? Which?
  Yes. It is being used to generate Tobiko project documentation page:
    https://opendev.org/x/tobiko/src/branch/master/doc/source

- If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
  This plugin is not managed by the Openstack release process.

- Do I need to update anything else?
  It doesn't. Release 1.0.0 only has below requirements (both already added):
    https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme/blob/c9b1bde560d8ee31400e4e4f92f2e8d7a42265ce/setup.py#L120-L123
    - sphinx>=1.6
    - docutils<0.18

Change-Id: Ic75b781ce842e93ed4fe4730abbe79a108af3dc5

- Do I need to update anything else?
  It doesn't. Release 1.0.0 only has below requirements (both already added):
    https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme/blob/c9b1bde560d8ee31400e4e4f92f2e8d7a42265ce/setup.py#L120-L123
    - sphinx>=1.6

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? Which?

- If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

commit_message:
Add Spinx RTD theme

The RTD theme [1] is being used by x/tobiko [2] project
to generate its documentation page [3]

[1] https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme
[2] https://opendev.org/x/tobiko
[3] https://tobiko.readthedocs.io

- Is the library actively maintained?
  It is. On Sep 21th we had the last release (1.0.0)
  There are many recent commits on master branch:
    https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme/commits/master

- Is the library good code?
  This is a widely used sphinx plugin used to generate
  many documentation pages. It has been working without
  any problem to generate Tobiko doc page since years:

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  It is:
    https://sphinx-rtd-theme.readthedocs.io/en/stable/development.html#supported-dependencies

- Is the library license compatible?
  It is being distributed under The MIT License:
    https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme/blob/master/LICENSE

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
  It is:
    https://packages.ubuntu.com/hirsute/all/sphinx-rtd-theme-common
    https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/python-sphinx_rtd_theme

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
  The default OpenStack Sphinx theme is not allowed to be used by non official OpenStack projects
  Therefore Tobiko switch to use the RTD one that is the one provided by the same page where
  Tobiko's documentation is hosted:
    https://tobiko.readthedocs.io/

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? Which?
  Yes. It is being used to generate Tobiko project documentation page:
    https://opendev.org/x/tobiko/src/branch/master/doc/source

- If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
  This plugin is not managed by the Openstack release process.

- Do I need to update anything else?
  It doesn't. Release 1.0.0 only has below requirements (both already added):
    https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme/blob/c9b1bde560d8ee31400e4e4f92f2e8d7a42265ce/setup.py#L120-L123
    - sphinx>=1.6
    - docutils<0.18

Change-Id: Ic75b781ce842e93ed4fe4730abbe79a108af3dc5

To check the existance of a namespace, instead of listing the
namespaces directory (by default "/var/run/netns"), this patch
directly checks the existence of the namespace directory, using
"os.path.exists".

This check is faster than listing the whole directory and avoids
timeout problems as reported in the related bug.

Conflicts:
      neutron/privileged/agent/linux/utils.py

Closes-Bug: #1947974
Change-Id: I558d50d28378beb3710d98a2113ff9549c82ae17
(cherry picked from commit 8127221479834350465251839ab88056f4f64fb4)

commit_message:
Check a namespace existence by checking only its own directory

To check the existance of a namespace, instead of listing the
namespaces directory (by default "/var/run/netns"), this patch
directly checks the existence of the namespace directory, using
"os.path.exists".

This check is faster than listing the whole directory and avoids
timeout problems as reported in the related bug.

Conflicts:
      neutron/privileged/agent/linux/utils.py

Closes-Bug: #1947974
Change-Id: I558d50d28378beb3710d98a2113ff9549c82ae17
(cherry picked from commit 8127221479834350465251839ab88056f4f64fb4)
(cherry picked from commit 6a9c05a92498630b85102eb6af1eccb415fd605a)

commit_message:
Add support for running neutron api by httpd+mod_wsgi

This change allows users to run neutron api by httpd+mod_wsgi with
an independent rpc worker service. Setting service_name to httpd is no
longer supported, because it results in incomplete deployment without
rpc services.

Change-Id: Id530e02e49e5fc020e13760bfcf38615da9da86a

commit_message:
Remove explicit set for whole_disk_image: true

As described in the related-bug we should stop hard coding the value
to true in the release files otherwise we cannot override it with zuul
vars.

Also, as the only role which consumes whole_disk_image, the libvirt
role now depends on extras-common.

Also explicitly pass the whole_disk_image var to the molecule test
as the extras-common role is not in play for those. Patch at [1] lets
us override with job vars or sets this according to branch.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/817243
Related-Bug: 1949765
Change-Id: I0b555676ce565d142a08e9d38d9e3c8ee7cb1a92

commit_message:
[Pure Storage] Add new params for FlashArray Cinder driver

Backport note to stable/wallaby:
Merge conflict resolved due to change in format of file.
Master uses `create_resources` and uses single quotes,
where stable/wallaby has not moved to that formatting yet.

Depends-On: Ia48fa3fa8ce3a3563fdab0966dc5a44f30248bc8
Change-Id: I9ab50d6c0835ea69044249f1cbbbf10f9b6a2498
(cherry picked from commit bb89515468a7cb771227eed98b33b6b771f2744e)

[{'created': '2021-11-11 23:05:04.000000000', 'message': 'Keystone: Remove unused container_puppet_tasks

This was introduced to manage keystone resources (users, projects and
so on) by puppet but now these resources are managed by ansible.

Change-Id: I9e76f21e41e2891f959cbf41b89cba07b2e67632
(cherry picked from commit 925e2db462c76b01f46611b8052e127d9d61b408)

commit_message:
Keystone: Remove unused container_puppet_tasks

This was introduced to manage keystone resources (users, projects and
so on) by puppet but now these resources are managed by ansible.

Change-Id: I9e76f21e41e2891f959cbf41b89cba07b2e67632
(cherry picked from commit 925e2db462c76b01f46611b8052e127d9d61b408)

commit_message:
Adding temporary workaround for libvirt-failures

This is workaround for downstream osp17 jobs, TripleO now defaults to
libvirt's  "modular daemons" after patch[1]. But this required libvirt > 7.4,
this is a temporary workaround to move back to monolithic modular libvirt daemon
till we move RHOSP17 to RHEL9 which will provide libvirt > 7.4.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/814568

Co-Authored-By: Sandeep Yadav <sandyada@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Soniya Vyas <svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I32a87e966625e44f5bd32992271aad4ddb753a9d

commit_message:
Replace deprecated assertEquals

The assertEquals method has been deprecated since it was renamed
to assertEqual in Python 3.2.

https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Change-Id: I559ad57c2d96a3bb51080c72816f39d3baa4c9dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-16 19:12:10.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Increase SSH exec timeout in manila jobs

Some jobs may fail depending on the nodes they run uppon. In order
to mitigate this issue, the timeout could be increased and we'd
have a lower probability of those failures caused by timeouts
while running commands.

Change-Id: I14768075a2ea60781e03e979b8f015ac0d7abd64
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Increase SSH exec timeout in manila jobs

Some jobs may fail depending on the nodes they run uppon. In order
to mitigate this issue, the timeout could be increased and we'd
have a lower probability of those failures caused by timeouts
while running commands.

Change-Id: I14768075a2ea60781e03e979b8f015ac0d7abd64

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-04 16:21:00.000000000', 'message': 'Do not set project_id for floating ip ports

Floating IP ports should not have a project_id assigned to them as they
are not managed by the owner of a project, but by OpenStack itself. With
a project_id assigned they also count towards the port quota of said
project, which they should not. Therefore, we do not set a project_id
anymore on Floating IP creation for the Floating IP port. This is in
line with the behaviour we currently have for gateway interfaces of
routers.

Change-Id: I053d48166141e5cdbd39a1235a43b06d64478bc1
Closes-Bug: #1949767
'}]
commit_message:
Do not set project_id for floating ip ports

Floating IP ports should not have a project_id assigned to them as they
are not managed by the owner of a project, but by OpenStack itself. With
a project_id assigned they also count towards the port quota of said
project, which they should not. Therefore, we do not set a project_id
anymore on Floating IP creation for the Floating IP port. This is in
line with the behaviour we currently have for gateway interfaces of
routers.

Change-Id: I053d48166141e5cdbd39a1235a43b06d64478bc1
Closes-Bug: #1949767

commit_message:
Use service_net_map for ceph_dashboard_vip

Instead of if conditionals on hard-coded network names, use the
ServiceNetMap. CephDashboardNetwork defaults to storage_dashboard
with a fallback to 'ctlplane' in the ServiceNetMap.

This will allow custom network names to be used, via overriding
CephDashboardNetwork in ServiceNetMap or via service_net_map_replace
in network data.

Related-Bug: #1946239
Depends-On: I9a62b2cf24b2dd020de74e18af8c7bc0535d12d9
Change-Id: I145d6c0ddd3cbbfed92113db56e22299ab7c9b08
(cherry picked from commit 3af34f0c68383ff733039f075fe7728baf0f888f)

commit_message:
octavia: allow using log_config_append=null

This patch allows the user to set log_config_append
to null which will flip back to the original shipped
logging config.

Change-Id: I1a2b90f208286a61c4ca5799a75d46d44bcd5296

commit_message:
Fix node labels for masakari monitors

Fix node labels for monitors agents as they need to run on the compute node where libvirt daemonset is running.

commit_message:
Revert "Add validation config file mechanism"

This reverts commit 11488cd88d6caca0e9e41d589936ec525d62eea4.
The commit broke "openstack complete", which creates the bash-completion files for the openstack CLI. This is a significant UX regression.

Reason for revert: <INSERT REASONING HERE>

Change-Id: I663a49c5df4666dd4ed47fd3630d06058e92a372

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-21 19:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-21 19:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-21 19:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-21 20:02:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-21 20:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-21 20:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-21 20:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-21 20:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-24 13:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-05-25 14:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

I think it might be better to give precedence to CLI supplied options over the config file options.
They are easier to change than the contents of a file. And such approach would be consistent with other programs approach to coexistence of the config files and CLI configuration.'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-05-25 14:37:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1
> 
> (7 comments)
> 
> I think it might be better to give precedence to CLI supplied options over the config file options.
> They are easier to change than the contents of a file. And such approach would be consistent with other programs approach to coexistence of the config files and CLI configuration.

I disagree pretty strongly with this assertion.  The very nature of a configuration file is that I trust it to be absolute source of truth for my software.  If I configure something in a file, and the software behaves such that the configuration option is not relevant, that would be a great source of confusion for me.

The first thing one does when one diagnoses why a thing didn't happen as expected is to verify the configuration on disk, and that would mean the config file.  It's the first and last place to look.

At the most, we should offer that a command line (dynamic) option has clashed with a configuration file option."}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-05-25 19:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

First, I really think we need to differentiate the configuration part of the VF from the Ansible one. For the latter, we should provide an ansible.cfg file for that, period.

2nd, How will this file be created and provided to the user? Would it be possible to generate this default configuration file on the fly through the CLI? How will we manage keys deprecation/update/removal etc..? How can the user be sure that his file is up to date with the VF code?

About the precedence choice, I think the configuration file should contain the default setup for the VF. The user will be able to modify it to his taste and he should be able to override some of them through the CLI argument(s) ... and those will take precedence from the configuration file! This is it should work IMHO!'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-25 20:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-05-25 20:42:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> First, I really think we need to differentiate the configuration part of the VF from the Ansible one. For the latter, we should provide an ansible.cfg file for that, period.

As my previous comment, I'm not agree. I don't see why the user should deal with two configuration files since the VF is just a wrapper on Ansible, so the config file is simply an Ansible config file extended.

> 
> 2nd, How will this file be created and provided to the user? Would it be possible to generate this default configuration file on the fly through the CLI? How will we manage keys deprecation/update/removal etc..? How can the user be sure that his file is up to date with the VF code?

Providing a config file generation can be a futur feature, but I think for now the review here is a simple proposal to a better usability of the framework in general.
If the demo config file present in the review is the source of truth for the parameters, then we just have to keep it up to date if something is moving.

> 
> About the precedence choice, I think the configuration file should contain the default setup for the VF. The user will be able to modify it to his taste and he should be able to override some of them through the CLI argument(s) ... and those will take precedence from the configuration file! This is it should work IMHO!

As said on IRC, you statement here expects we load and use by default the config file on each CLI calls, which is not the main behavior here. It's mainly an optional feature that allow the user to extend the usage of the VF.

And if this file comes to became one of the core pieces of the VF, then comes other questions like where do we put this file on the fs & so on...

The review here introduce the concept, then if we want to make this as a corner stone of the framework, we should iterate on it imho."}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-05-26 16:13:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

Re-framing this after a conversation I had with Alex; the behaviour we're really describing if we take the Gael / Jiri approach is actually characterising this better as an answer file, not a configuration file.

I'll speak more to this in our tech call tomorrow, but under that context the behaviour would make sense.

Configuration files are more for services / cleanly defined operating tools, and answer files are convenient locations to put switches in order to avoid lengthy command lines.

I think there was some scoping or terminology muddying here, which made this discussion butt heads so much.

Re-framing this as an answer file is the answer to our troubles."}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-05-31 08:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

> Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1
> 
> (7 comments)
> 
> I think it might be better to give precedence to CLI supplied options over the config file options.
> They are easier to change than the contents of a file. And such approach would be consistent with other programs approach to coexistence of the config files and CLI configuration.

To clarify my position: My original sentiment towards the precedence of the arguments/options is not the deciding factor in my evaluation.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-06-01 07:34:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1
> 
> Re-framing this after a conversation I had with Alex; the behaviour we're really describing if we take the Gael / Jiri approach is actually characterising this better as an answer file, not a configuration file.
> 
> I'll speak more to this in our tech call tomorrow, but under that context the behaviour would make sense.
> 
> Configuration files are more for services / cleanly defined operating tools, and answer files are convenient locations to put switches in order to avoid lengthy command lines.
> 
> I think there was some scoping or terminology muddying here, which made this discussion butt heads so much.
> 
> Re-framing this as an answer file is the answer to our troubles.

David,

In the context of this first and current implementation of this patch, Yes I agree with calling this an answer file (not fully though ;-). But if we deliver a /etc/*vf*/*vf*.cfg file and stick with what Ansible does [1] and if the vf is loading it each time the CLI is used, this is what we call a configuration file.

An answer file serves and is linked to an unattended installation process of product, installation that is performed without user interaction during its progress or with no user present at all. If I am not mistaken, we are not dealing with this.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/config.html"}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-06-03 16:38:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-06-03 16:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Workflow-1

Still WIP'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-06-10 12:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-06-10 12:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-06-10 12:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-06-10 12:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

This revision #59 resolved the str obj no keys glitch, but the non-use of ANSIBLE_ variables remains a problem.

vagrant@ubuntu-focal:~$ cat validation.cfg 
[ansible_environment]
ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH = '/usr/local/share/ansible/roles'
ANSIBLE_LIBRARY = '/usr/local/share/ansible/library'
ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS = '/usr/local/share/ansible/plugins/lookup'
ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS = '/usr/local/share/ansible/callback_plugins'
vagrant@ubuntu-focal:~$ validation run --group prep --config validation.cfg --validation-dir /usr/local/share/ansible/validation-playbooks/
Validation config file found: /home/vagrant/validation.cfg
No validation has been run, please check log in the Ansible working directory.
vagrant@ubuntu-focal:~$ validation run --group prep --validation-dir /usr/local/share/ansible/validation-playbooks/
Validation config file found: /home/vagrant/validation.cfg
No validation has been run, please check log in the Ansible working directory."}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-08-11 13:25:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 59:

Hey, I used what you've pasted here and for me it's due to the quote in the variable value, if you try with this it's working on my tests:

[ansible_environment]
ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH = /usr/local/share/ansible/roles
ANSIBLE_LIBRARY = /usr/local/share/ansible/library
ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS = /usr/local/share/ansible/plugins/lookup
ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS = /usr/local/share/ansible/callback_plugins"}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-08-11 14:57:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 59:

> Hey, I used what you've pasted here and for me it's due to the quote in the variable value, if you try with this it's working on my tests:
> 
> [ansible_environment]
> ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH = /usr/local/share/ansible/roles
> ANSIBLE_LIBRARY = /usr/local/share/ansible/library
> ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS = /usr/local/share/ansible/plugins/lookup
> ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS = /usr/local/share/ansible/callback_plugins

Just confirmed this in my environment - you're absolutely right.  It was the quotes that messed it up!

Good catch. :-)

If it's not too much trouble I'd like to see that case trapped because it's absolutely normal for people to use single or double quotes on moderately complex strings due to risk of dodgy interpolation.

Is it possible to check that input without too much hassle?  Or should we just document this, in your opinion?  My preference would be for my use case to work as intended."}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-08-11 15:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by David Peacock <dpeacock@redhat.com>

While testing the code I noticed that 'output.log' file is left after each unit test run. 
This didn't happen in the master so I assume that some change here introduced this behavior.
While I'm not sure how the tests changed, but now they hit the final lines of the 'cli.run.Run.get_parser' method, where it checks if `the parsed_args.output_log` is set.
And since it is, it writes the output to a file.

Either we can mock the log writing function, or we can set that attribute to False/None, either way it's not a good idea to write random files on drive during unit test runs."}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-18 07:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 66:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-20 08:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 66:

commit_message:
Add validation config file mechanism

Introduce validation config file.
The config default location of the config file will be stored
in /etc/validation.cfg

The variables precedence will be the following:
* user's cli args
* config file
* default interval values

Change-Id: I05c54a43bc0a03878793cca3f51e23f4a8b63a23

commit_message:
Pure Storage driver: Add support for pure_host_personality

This change introduces support for the pure_host_personality parameter
in Pure Storage volume driver.

Change-Id: I933ccfbd779719056ec05196c3d4165c6882f03b
(cherry picked from commit 714c56b2a072f6732c5f4f391ad6a4e93f8ac651)

commit_message:
mini-mirror: Upate build distro to bionic

The xenial Dockerfile has been removed from the repo, but build.sh
still tries to use it by default. This change updates the build
distro to bionic.

Change-Id: Ic6fef1ea51de8bfb1d35bdbf17227086dc01bf8a

commit_message:
Use shell module to generate keys

openssh_keypair ansible module was moved to community.crypto
collection from Ansible-Core 2.11, we can't use it now.
For using it in the product we either need to package and add to
deps and maintain the whole community.crypto module, either to
use 'shell' command to generate the keys.
Added "creates" so keys won't be overridden if they exists,
keeping the idempotency. [1]

[1] https://github.com/ansible-collections/community.crypto/blob/
91d98c44137cde53726bfa8f61898f3c28041e20/plugins/module_utils/openssh/backends/common.py#L188

Change-Id: Ib9a31518ee9408d89abff4c4eb18a7cfe243fb58

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-22 17:46:50.000000000', 'message': "Implement project personas in custom barbican policy file

This commit updates the default barbican policies in enable-secure-rbac.yaml to
implement consistent support for project personas (project-admin,
project-member, and project-reader) with other OpenStack services. The
project-admin is still considered a system administrator.

This behavior will change in future releases (likely Yoga) when we have
a community wide goal to finish system-scope adoption. At that point, we
can remove these overrides and use the defaults in barbican, which is working
to adopt full support for system peronas in Yoga, and we'll get more
functionality without these overrides.

Change-Id: Iadd24554727d9a5000c6842954fe1deede833a8e

commit_message:
Implement project personas in custom barbican policy file

This commit updates the default barbican policies in enable-secure-rbac.yaml to
implement consistent support for project personas (project-admin,
project-member, and project-reader) with other OpenStack services. The
project-admin is still considered a system administrator.

This behavior will change in future releases (likely Yoga) when we have
a community wide goal to finish system-scope adoption. At that point, we
can remove these overrides and use the defaults in barbican, which is working
to adopt full support for system peronas in Yoga, and we'll get more
functionality without these overrides.

Change-Id: Iadd24554727d9a5000c6842954fe1deede833a8e

[WIP] New mon_host population strategy

This patch re-works how the mon_host IP addresses get populated
in the other ceph jobs, deployments, daemonsets, etc.

Change-Id: I39015afa0a5e586d38aad86a977db00640c1cad1

subject: compute: Fetch updated image *after* waiting
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-11-15 12:31:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-11-16 17:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nsquashed into the parent'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-15 12:31:52.000000000', 'message': "compute: Fetch updated image *after* waiting

If a user requests that we wait (--wait) for a server image to become
active before returning, then we should probably return the final image.
If we don't then the image can appear to be in a non-active state when
it fact it's active. Correct this by fetching the image after the wait
call.

Change-Id: I0e64d2474866c619985b29cb7b96d35f6d5f9164
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
compute: Fetch updated image *after* waiting

If a user requests that we wait (--wait) for a server image to become
active before returning, then we should probably return the final image.
If we don't then the image can appear to be in a non-active state when
it fact it's active. Correct this by fetching the image after the wait
call.

Change-Id: I0e64d2474866c619985b29cb7b96d35f6d5f9164
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow to provide mdev addresses as list

With new Ampere GPUs you need to explicitly define explicit lists of PCI
devices which length depends on picked type as placement can't pick them
automatically due to nvidia driver brokeness.

In order to have readable representation of the variable it's worth
to make it iterable but keep a simple string for
backwards compatability.

Change-Id: I2a1e85efc8ad4f6a2596e6d53b1d793b2f934758

commit_message:
Use service_net_map for ceph_dashboard_vip

Instead of if conditionals on hard-coded network names, use the
ServiceNetMap. CephDashboardNetwork defaults to storage_dashboard
with a fallback to 'ctlplane' in the ServiceNetMap.

This will allow custom network names to be used, via overriding
CephDashboardNetwork in ServiceNetMap or via service_net_map_replace
in network data.

Related-Bug: #1946239
Depends-On: I9a62b2cf24b2dd020de74e18af8c7bc0535d12d9
Change-Id: I145d6c0ddd3cbbfed92113db56e22299ab7c9b08
(cherry picked from commit 3af34f0c68383ff733039f075fe7728baf0f888f)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-11-16 08:25:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-11-16 10:02:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-11-16 15:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-11-16 15:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-16 08:25:28.000000000', 'message': 'source-repositories: don't use --git-dir

A recent(-ish) change in git [1] has exposed a bug in caching that
appears in one very specific circumstance -- updating the
openstack/openstack super-repo [2].

This repo gets a submodule update every time something is pushed.  By
using "--git-dir" while the cwd is one-level above the actual repo we
are confusing [1] which is not finding the submodule directories
correctly and giving us an error:

 Could not access submodule 'foo'

for every submodule that has updated between now and the last time we
updated the cache. [3]

The git manual does warn about this

 If you just want to run git as if it was started in <path> then use
 git -C <path>.

Indeed, that is what we want to do in this path.  Modify the calls to
use -C.

[1] https://github.com/git/git/commit/505a27659638614157a36b218fdaf25fe9fed0ce
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack/
[3] The result for opendev production is that image builds fail every
    time an openstack/* project is checked in; we then race to retry
    the build before another commit lands and updates the submodules
    again.

Change-Id: Iadb23454e29d8869e11407e1592007b0f0963e17
'}]
commit_message:
source-repositories: don't use --git-dir

A recent(-ish) change in git [1] has exposed a bug in caching that
appears in one very specific circumstance -- updating the
openstack/openstack super-repo [2].

This repo gets a submodule update every time something is pushed.  By
using "--git-dir" while the cwd is one-level above the actual repo we
are confusing [1] which is not finding the submodule directories
correctly and giving us an error:

 Could not access submodule 'foo'

for every submodule that has updated between now and the last time we
updated the cache. [3]

The git manual does warn about this

 If you just want to run git as if it was started in <path> then use
 git -C <path>.

Indeed, that is what we want to do in this path.  Modify the calls to
use -C.

[1] https://github.com/git/git/commit/505a27659638614157a36b218fdaf25fe9fed0ce
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack/
[3] The result for opendev production is that image builds fail every
    time an openstack/* project is checked in; we then race to retry
    the build before another commit lands and updates the submodules
    again.

Change-Id: Iadb23454e29d8869e11407e1592007b0f0963e17

commit_message:
Map system_scope in creds dictionary

An earlier patch[1] added a mapping for context 'system_scope'
to 'system' when enforce was called with a RequestContext
object. However, enforce can also be called with a creds dictionary
that may contain the context 'system_scope' element. When this
occured, 'system_scope' was not mapped to 'system' and the enforce
would fail with an InvalidScope exception.
This patch moves the 'system_scope' mapping from only occuring
with RequestContext objects to also map it when a creds dictonary
is passed to enforce.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.policy/+/578995

Change-Id: I83a22c3f825bad0c88018118f8630a20a445965e
(cherry picked from commit 9774108cf91408e9cb825b317f48a3a3f856e161)
(cherry picked from commit ff2a39fc619baafa956bee74a2574f5438d40767)
(cherry picked from commit 639b47198b3334c33f4675a9210c31922c50be52)
(cherry picked from commit d8f837713653580e7b81032d1d67c400e663816b)

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: Ifcaf6993517d02bf54cd144efd247832947a009f
(cherry picked from commit 7b649af0c1569ebb61ed4e34da4a476ccb1474b9)
(cherry picked from commit 21df7f5a32b3eb0f7352eafd9f79c7ca28919938)
(cherry picked from commit bd6dd9592dfbb88f5215d50b4c9873ae6ffd40ba)

[{'created': '2021-11-15 22:26:29.000000000', 'message': "ssync: don't break chunked protocol on error

Only send the last chunk message when the connection is being shutdown
gracefully.  If we send the final chunk message when shutting down a
connection in the middle of another (failed/timedout) chunk we break
protocol and confuse the reciever leading to confusing tracebacks.

Change-Id: Ia49ee158736f6ad0b73797680242b06165abd9d1
"}, {'created': '2021-11-15 22:59:23.000000000', 'message': "ssync: don't break chunked protocol on error

Only send the last chunk message when the connection is being shutdown
gracefully.  If we send the final chunk message when shutting down a
connection in the middle of another (failed/timedout) chunk we break
protocol and confuse the reciever leading to confusing tracebacks.

Change-Id: Ia49ee158736f6ad0b73797680242b06165abd9d1
"}]
commit_message:
ssync: don't break chunked protocol on error

Only send the last chunk message when the connection is being shutdown
gracefully.  If we send the final chunk message when shutting down a
connection in the middle of another (failed/timedout) chunk we break
protocol and confuse the reciever leading to confusing tracebacks.

Partial-Bug: #1621390

Change-Id: Ia49ee158736f6ad0b73797680242b06165abd9d1

commit_message:
Restore blkid compatibility with Centos 7

The blkid version included in util-linux 2.23.2 does not allow long
options name for probe and match-tag.
Use the short single letter name to restore compatibility with Centos 7

Story: 2009328
Task: 43764

Change-Id: I10a52c16ebe4e519d0af63b36c3a89fd5d371319

commit_message:
[Stable only] Fix CI jobs

This patch switches using f-strings instead of regular ones in places
where pep8 was complaining about with error C0209. That part is
cherry-picked from commit [1] in master branch.

This patch also removes lower-constraints job as we agreed some time ago
to not run that job in the stable branches.

It also removes functional and tempest jobs which runs OVS and
OVN from master/main branches. We don't need to test that in the stable
release. Those jobs should be run in the master branch and in stable
branches are not needed anymore.

Finally it also adds test_source_ip_port_{tcp,udp}_traffic tests to the
skiplist as those tests are very unstable now and requires more
investigation what's wrong there. This is "backport" of the patch [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider/+/816829
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider/+/799864

Conflicts:
    lower-constraints.txt
    zuul.d/project.yaml

Change-Id: Id7d8422f07475aee58c2f283da67cc5e171f889b
(cherry picked from commit 071d3347b57d8a5a469fcf06acb1870c279b0c65)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 19:50:52.000000000', 'message': 'Port binding based on events during live migration

Currently port binding call is made at destination compute in post live
migration phase. This may cause network outage during post-copy as the
virtual CPUs are paused immediately at source and unpaused at
destination by transferring a minimum set of pages.

The following domain life cycle events are emitted in this order during
post-copy:

* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_STARTED(destination)
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY(source)--migration
  entered post-copy mode
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_RESUMED_POSTCOPY(destination)--guest
  is running on the destinaton host while some if its
  memory pages still remain on sourcehost.
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_RESUMED_MIGRATED(destination)
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_STOPPED_MIGRATED(source)--migration
  finished successfully and the destination host holds
  a complete guest state.

In this change, dest host port binding activation is done when the
following events are emitted at source for post-copy and pre-copy:

* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_MIGRATED

This reduces the network outage during live migration as network switch
is done right before VM resumes at destination.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ic5cab99944df9e501ba2032eb96911c36304494d
Closes-Bug: #1605016
(cherry picked from commit 1f48d3d83b4d5f6f9cd96ee06d2fc005635c1ff9)

* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_RESUMED_POSTCOPY(destination)--guest

* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_RESUMED_MIGRATED(destination)
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_STOPPED_MIGRATED(source)--migration
  finished successfully and the destination host holds
  a complete guest state.

In this change, dest host port binding activation is done when the
following events are emitted at source for post-copy and pre-copy:

* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_MIGRATED

This reduces the network outage during live migration as network switch

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Port binding based on events during live migration

Currently port binding call is made at destination compute in post live
migration phase. This may cause network outage during post-copy as the
virtual CPUs are paused immediately at source and unpaused at
destination by transferring a minimum set of pages.

The following domain life cycle events are emitted in this order during
post-copy:

* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_STARTED(destination)
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY(source)--migration
  entered post-copy mode
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_RESUMED_POSTCOPY(destination)--guest
  is running on the destinaton host while some if its
  memory pages still remain on sourcehost.
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_RESUMED_MIGRATED(destination)
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_STOPPED_MIGRATED(source)--migration
  finished successfully and the destination host holds
  a complete guest state.

In this change, dest host port binding activation is done when the
following events are emitted at source for post-copy and pre-copy:

* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY
* VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_MIGRATED

This reduces the network outage during live migration as network switch
is done right before VM resumes at destination.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ic5cab99944df9e501ba2032eb96911c36304494d
Closes-Bug: #1605016
(cherry picked from commit 1f48d3d83b4d5f6f9cd96ee06d2fc005635c1ff9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-12 08:44:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add br-int-flows-analyze.py script

This is a (somewhat poorly executed) attempt at making sense of the
flows dumped by ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int.

Our idea was to have a tool that can help us filter flow rules
pertaining to a VM and, if possible, to make them more readable.

This tool can be used by running, for example :
br-int-flows-analyze.py --vm-uuid VM_UUID --ingress

It will first display the list of rules that MAY be traversed by ingress
traffic for the designated VM and after that, a summary with possibly
some annotations about the rules (for example, when a port range is
split across multiple rules, it will try to merge them together).

Change-Id: I251e5b4c719d32c6283eb0e8888e7510dd35cea2
'}]
commit_message:
Add br-int-flows-analyze.py script

This is a (somewhat poorly executed) attempt at making sense of the
flows dumped by ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int.

Our idea was to have a tool that can help us filter flow rules
pertaining to a VM and, if possible, to make them more readable.

This tool can be used by running, for example :
br-int-flows-analyze.py --vm-uuid VM_UUID --ingress

It will first display the list of rules that MAY be traversed by ingress
traffic for the designated VM and after that, a summary with possibly
some annotations about the rules (for example, when a port range is
split across multiple rules, it will try to merge them together).

Change-Id: I251e5b4c719d32c6283eb0e8888e7510dd35cea2

commit_message:
Increase SLO maximums

Allow up to 10,000 segments per manifest, to match AWS limits. Since
this requires more HEAD requests and we don't want to cause client
timeouts, also increase the default concurrency. And since more segments
mean larger manifests, increase the default max manifest size.

Change-Id: I60f4504abfa392ab5e05aff96238438cd4082201

commit_message:
Remove run-devstack role from run_functional_job playbook

There is no need to run that role in the functional nor fullstack jobs
not running it can save few minutes in each job's run.

Change-Id: Ic363c5c805d02bdc93317423b95a1cd89c16876a

commit_message:
yum-config: add support to download repo from url

yum-config now support downloading a repo file from a url and
make updates on its options.
A new parameter 'down-url' was added to the cli and ansible module.

Change-Id: I6dba307be5e66892ecfba04df7766ae8dbbfa71e
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

There are no SIGs repositories for Rocky Linux
(at least not all that we require - only NFV OVS
is available) - the plan for now is to use CentOS
ones (using centos-release-* packages available in
Rocky Linux repos) as there's a chance those will
be alive after CentOS Linux 8 is EOL [1].

Broken images:
swift - there is liberasurecode-devel for Rocky
bifrost - bindep doesn't support Rocky yet [2]

[1]: https://pagure.io/centos-infra/issue/400
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/bindep/+/809362

commit_message:
WIP: Rocky Linux

There are no SIGs repositories for Rocky Linux
(at least not all that we require - only NFV OVS
is available) - the plan for now is to use CentOS
ones (using centos-release-* packages available in
Rocky Linux repos) as there's a chance those will
be alive after CentOS Linux 8 is EOL [1].

Broken images:
swift - there is liberasurecode-devel for Rocky
bifrost - bindep doesn't support Rocky yet [2]

[1]: https://pagure.io/centos-infra/issue/400
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/bindep/+/809362

Change-Id: Ib93e98f9d603f6e8a42034a5dcc1c7d7d7bb132e

commit_message:
[DNM] Add specifying tenant in notification

This patch fixes separate resources related to ETSI NFV-SOL based
VNF management by using tenant.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/x/fenix/+/816974
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/817183

Change-Id: I5c7fda7448dc87e53b03f0083beead41a0c21a66

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-23 12:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate support for floppy drives in 'Xena'

Emulated floppy drives are vulnerable.  See the infamous "VENOM" CVE[1]
where a floppy disk controller could cause crash a guest.  Latest is
this[2] "null pointer dereference" vulnerability in QEMU's floppy drive
emulator.

So, deprecate "all things floppy", i.e. both the image properties for
setting floppy as a disk bus (via ``hw_floppy_bus=fd``) and as a rescue
device (via ``hw_rescue_device=floppy``) are deprecated.

[1] https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-3456

[2] https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2020-09/msg07779.html
    -- [PATCH v2] fdc: check null block pointer before r/w data transfer

Change-Id: I69427ff4dcaf5fb95507ef688f2fe5409b27d0c8
blueprint: remove-support-for-floppy-disks
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-11-15 13:30:06.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate support for floppy drives

Emulated floppy drives are vulnerable.  See the infamous "VENOM" CVE[1]
where a floppy disk controller could cause crash a guest.  Latest is
this[2] "null pointer dereference" vulnerability in QEMU's floppy drive
emulator.

So, deprecate "all things floppy", i.e.

  - The ability to configure floppy bus and disk-type during instance
    creation (e.g. ``openstack server create --block-device
    uuid=$UUID,source_type=image,disk_type=floppy,disk_bus=fd``) will be
    deprecated.

  - Both the image properties for setting bus for floppy disk types
    (``hw_floppy_bus=fd``) and floppy as a rescue device (via
    ``hw_rescue_device=floppy``) will be deprecated.

[1] https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-3456

[2] https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2020-09/msg07779.html
    -- [PATCH v2] fdc: check null block pointer before r/w data transfer

Change-Id: I69427ff4dcaf5fb95507ef688f2fe5409b27d0c8
blueprint: remove-support-for-floppy-disks
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate support for floppy drives

Emulated floppy drives are vulnerable.  See the infamous "VENOM" CVE[1]
where a floppy disk controller could cause crash a guest.  Latest is
this[2] "null pointer dereference" vulnerability in QEMU's floppy drive
emulator.

So, deprecate "all things floppy", i.e.

  - The ability to configure floppy bus and disk-type during instance
    creation (e.g. ``openstack server create --block-device
    uuid=$UUID,source_type=image,disk_type=floppy,disk_bus=fd``) will be
    deprecated.

  - Both the image properties for setting bus for floppy disk types
    (``hw_floppy_bus=fd``) and floppy as a rescue device (via
    ``hw_rescue_device=floppy``) will be deprecated.

[1] https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-3456

[2] https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2020-09/msg07779.html
    -- [PATCH v2] fdc: check null block pointer before r/w data transfer

Change-Id: I69427ff4dcaf5fb95507ef688f2fe5409b27d0c8
blueprint: remove-support-for-floppy-disks
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Store and allow libvirt instance device buses and models to be updated

This was previously accepted and then deferred during Xena.

Small updates have been made to the list of properties to be stashed,
additional show command and format of the commands in the spec.

Blueprint: libvirt-device-bus-model-update
Change-Id: Ia1f69083c384a0eda52cd483a3a58fd5149964ef

commit_message:
Remove "tenant_id" members from any Network resource

This is part of the remaining technical debt of the specs
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/moving-to-keystone-v3.html

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/keystone-v3
Change-Id: Ib98361a12d063f4dc812fcabd7fa90a178858806

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-22 17:49:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Nova thinks deleted volume is attached

There are cases where a cinder volume no longer exists yet nova still
thinks it is attached to an instance and we cannot detach it anymore.

This has been observed when running cinder-csi, where it makes a volume
delete request as soon as the volume status says its available.

This is a cinder race condition, and like most race conditions is not
simple to explain.

Some context on the issue:

- Cinder API uses the volume "status" field as a locking mechanism to
  prevent concurrent request processing on the same volume.

- Most cinder operations are asynchronous, so the API returns before the
  operation has been completed by the cinder-volume service, but the
  attachment operations such as creating/updating/deleting an attachment
  are synchronous, so the API only returns to the caller after the
  cinder-volume service has completed the operation.

- Our current code **incorrectly** modifies the status of the volume
  both on the cinder-volume and the cinder-api services on the
  attachment delete operation.

The actual set of events that leads to the issue reported in this BZ are:

[Cinder-CSI]
- Requests Nova to detach volume (Request R1)

[Nova]
- R1: Asks cinder-api to delete the attachment and **waits**

[Cinder-API]
- R1: Checks the status of the volume
- R1: Sends terminate connection request (R1) to cinder-volume and
  **waits**

[Cinder-Volume]
- R1: Ask the driver to terminate the connection
- R1: The driver asks the backend to unmap and unexport the volume
- R1: The status of the volume is changed in the DB to "available"

[Cinder-CSI]
- Asks Cinder to delete the volume (Request R2)

[Cinder-API]
- R2: Check that the volume's status is valid. It's available so it can
  be deleted.
- R2: Tell cinder-volume to delete the volume and return immediately.

[Cinder-Volume]
- R2: Volume is deleted and DB entry is deleted
- R1: Finish the termination of the connection

[Cinder-API]
- R1: Now that cinder-volume has finished the termination the code
  continues
- R1: Try to modify the volume in the DB
- R1: DB layer raises VolumeNotFound since the volume has been deleted
  from the DB
- R1: VolumeNotFound is converted to HTTP 404 status code which is
  returned to Nova

[Nova]
- R1: Cinder responds with 404 on the attachment delete request
- R1: Nova leaves the volume as attached, since the attachment delete
  failed

At this point the Cinder and Nova DBs are out of sync, because Nova
thinks that the attachment is connected and Cinder has detached the
volume and even deleted it.

Closes-Bug: #1937084
Change-Id: Iaf149dadad5791e81a3c0efd089d0ee66a1a5614

'}, {'created': '2021-10-15 15:47:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Race between attachment and volume deletion

There are cases where requests to delete an attachment made by Nova can
race other third-party requests to delete the overall volume.

This has been observed when running cinder-csi, where it first requests
that Nova detaches a volume before itself requesting that the overall
volume is deleted once it becomes `available`.

This is a cinder race condition, and like most race conditions is not
simple to explain.

Some context on the issue:

- Cinder API uses the volume "status" field as a locking mechanism to
  prevent concurrent request processing on the same volume.

- Most cinder operations are asynchronous, so the API returns before the
  operation has been completed by the cinder-volume service, but the
  attachment operations such as creating/updating/deleting an attachment
  are synchronous, so the API only returns to the caller after the
  cinder-volume service has completed the operation.

- Our current code **incorrectly** modifies the status of the volume
  both on the cinder-volume and the cinder-api services on the
  attachment delete operation.

The actual set of events that leads to the issue reported in this bug
are:

[Cinder-CSI]
- Requests Nova to detach volume (Request R1)

[Nova]
- R1: Asks cinder-api to delete the attachment and **waits**

[Cinder-API]
- R1: Checks the status of the volume
- R1: Sends terminate connection request (R1) to cinder-volume and
  **waits**

[Cinder-Volume]
- R1: Ask the driver to terminate the connection
- R1: The driver asks the backend to unmap and unexport the volume
- R1: The last attachment is removed from the DB and the status of the
      volume is changed in the DB to "available"

[Cinder-CSI]
- Checks that there are no attachments in the volume and asks Cinder to
  delete it (Request R2)

[Cinder-API]

- R2: Check that the volume's status is valid. It doesn't have
  attachments and is available, so it can be deleted.
- R2: Tell cinder-volume to delete the volume and return immediately.

[Cinder-Volume]
- R2: Volume is deleted and DB entry is deleted
- R1: Finish the termination of the connection

[Cinder-API]
- R1: Now that cinder-volume has finished the termination the code
  continues
- R1: Try to modify the volume in the DB
- R1: DB layer raises VolumeNotFound since the volume has been deleted
  from the DB
- R1: VolumeNotFound is converted to HTTP 404 status code which is
  returned to Nova

[Nova]
- R1: Cinder responds with 404 on the attachment delete request
- R1: Nova leaves the volume as attached, since the attachment delete
  failed

At this point the Cinder and Nova DBs are out of sync, because Nova
thinks that the attachment is connected and Cinder has detached the
volume and even deleted it.

Hardening is also being done on the Nova side [2] to accept that the
volume attachment may be gone.

This patch fixes the issue mentioned above, but there is a request on
Cinder-CSI [1] to use Nova as the source of truth regarding its
attachments that, when implemented, would also fix the issue.

[1]: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/issues/1645
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%2522bug/1937084%2522+project:openstack/nova

Closes-Bug: #1937084
Change-Id: Iaf149dadad5791e81a3c0efd089d0ee66a1a5614

commit_message:
Fix: Race between attachment and volume deletion

There are cases where requests to delete an attachment made by Nova can
race other third-party requests to delete the overall volume.

This has been observed when running cinder-csi, where it first requests
that Nova detaches a volume before itself requesting that the overall
volume is deleted once it becomes `available`.

This is a cinder race condition, and like most race conditions is not
simple to explain.

Some context on the issue:

- Cinder API uses the volume "status" field as a locking mechanism to
  prevent concurrent request processing on the same volume.

- Most cinder operations are asynchronous, so the API returns before the
  operation has been completed by the cinder-volume service, but the
  attachment operations such as creating/updating/deleting an attachment
  are synchronous, so the API only returns to the caller after the
  cinder-volume service has completed the operation.

- Our current code **incorrectly** modifies the status of the volume
  both on the cinder-volume and the cinder-api services on the
  attachment delete operation.

The actual set of events that leads to the issue reported in this bug
are:

[Cinder-CSI]
- Requests Nova to detach volume (Request R1)

[Nova]
- R1: Asks cinder-api to delete the attachment and **waits**

[Cinder-API]
- R1: Checks the status of the volume
- R1: Sends terminate connection request (R1) to cinder-volume and
  **waits**

[Cinder-Volume]
- R1: Ask the driver to terminate the connection
- R1: The driver asks the backend to unmap and unexport the volume
- R1: The last attachment is removed from the DB and the status of the
      volume is changed in the DB to "available"

[Cinder-CSI]
- Checks that there are no attachments in the volume and asks Cinder to
  delete it (Request R2)

[Cinder-API]

- R2: Check that the volume's status is valid. It doesn't have
  attachments and is available, so it can be deleted.
- R2: Tell cinder-volume to delete the volume and return immediately.

[Cinder-Volume]
- R2: Volume is deleted and DB entry is deleted
- R1: Finish the termination of the connection

[Cinder-API]
- R1: Now that cinder-volume has finished the termination the code
  continues
- R1: Try to modify the volume in the DB
- R1: DB layer raises VolumeNotFound since the volume has been deleted
  from the DB
- R1: VolumeNotFound is converted to HTTP 404 status code which is
  returned to Nova

[Nova]
- R1: Cinder responds with 404 on the attachment delete request
- R1: Nova leaves the volume as attached, since the attachment delete
  failed

At this point the Cinder and Nova DBs are out of sync, because Nova
thinks that the attachment is connected and Cinder has detached the
volume and even deleted it.

Hardening is also being done on the Nova side [2] to accept that the
volume attachment may be gone.

This patch fixes the issue mentioned above, but there is a request on
Cinder-CSI [1] to use Nova as the source of truth regarding its
attachments that, when implemented, would also fix the issue.

[1]: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/issues/1645
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%2522bug/1937084%2522+project:openstack/nova

Closes-Bug: #1937084
Change-Id: Iaf149dadad5791e81a3c0efd089d0ee66a1a5614

commit_message:
[DVR] Fix update of the MTU in the DVR HA routers

This is follow up of the patch [1] which fixed updating MTU in the
snat namespace for the DVR routers.
In case of DVR-HA routers there was additional issue with that as
L3 agent tried to update MTU for the qr- interface in the
self.ha_namespace which, for DVR-HA routers is snat namespace.

This patch fixes that issue by setting MTU on the qr- interface in
qrouter namespace and also setting MTU on the snat interface in snat
namespace.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/799226

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Closes-bug: #1933273
Change-Id: I409bc674b65e4f495ebd42d03e97a09d51482339
(cherry picked from commit 21eabbcf03cb29be9899adbd6eaea207892cf07b)

[{'created': '2021-10-07 09:22:53.000000000', 'message': '[DVR] Fix update of the MTU in the SNAT namespace

When network's MTU is changed, Neutron sends notification about it
to the L3 agents. In case of DVR (and DVR HA) MTU is then changed in
the qrouter- namespace but should be also changed on snat interfaces
in the snat namespace. And that part was missing.

This patch adds special implementation of the internal_network_updated()
method in the DvrEdgeRouter class so it can configure MTU also for
in the snat namespace.

This patch also removed passing attributes "interface_name",
"ip_cidrs" and "mtu" to the internal_network_updated() method and adds
"port" dict to be passed there. It is consistent with what is already
done in e.g. internal_network_added() method and "port" dict is actually
necessary to configure properly snat internal interface in the snat
namespace.

This patch adds also functional test of update network mtu for all types
of routers as there was no such test at all.

There is additional issue with DVR-HA which isn't fixed with that patch
and for which follow up will be proposed. Because of that this patch is
marked as partial fix for the related bug.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

commit_message:
[DVR] Fix update of the MTU in the SNAT namespace

When network's MTU is changed, Neutron sends notification about it
to the L3 agents. In case of DVR (and DVR HA) MTU is then changed in
the qrouter- namespace but should be also changed on snat interfaces
in the snat namespace. And that part was missing.

This patch adds special implementation of the internal_network_updated()
method in the DvrEdgeRouter class so it can configure MTU also for
in the snat namespace.

This patch also removed passing attributes "interface_name",
"ip_cidrs" and "mtu" to the internal_network_updated() method and adds
"port" dict to be passed there. It is consistent with what is already
done in e.g. internal_network_added() method and "port" dict is actually
necessary to configure properly snat internal interface in the snat
namespace.

This patch adds also functional test of update network mtu for all types
of routers as there was no such test at all.

There is additional issue with DVR-HA which isn't fixed with that patch
and for which follow up will be proposed. Because of that this patch is
marked as partial fix for the related bug.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Related-Bug: #1933273
Change-Id: I200acfcaaae7f056ea9a563fead9ff2de8464971
(cherry picked from commit b5dd6efdca0aa6e7405a55d66c7042a49ec72214)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 15:57:32.000000000', 'message': "Allow for sharing SSH pubkeys across apps

Via the migration-ssh-auth-sharing config value, allow for defining
sets of related applications which should share their units' SSH keys
for the purpose of enabling instance migrations.  Existing behavior,
and the default behavior after this patch, is for SSH keys to only be
shared across units within a single related application; setting the
migration-ssh-auth-sharing config value provides opt-in support to
enable SSH key sharing across applications where it is deemed
appropriate.

Closes-Bug: #1468871
Change-Id: Ia142eceff56bb763fcca8ddf5b74b83f84bf3539
"}, {'created': '2021-09-02 16:19:22.000000000', 'message': "Allow for sharing SSH pubkeys across apps

Via the migration-ssh-auth-sharing config value, allow for defining
sets of related applications which should share their units' SSH keys
for the purpose of enabling instance migrations.  Existing behavior,
and the default behavior after this patch, is for SSH keys to only be
shared across units within a single related application; setting the
migration-ssh-auth-sharing config value provides opt-in support to
enable SSH key sharing across applications where it is deemed
appropriate.

Closes-Bug: #1468871
Change-Id: Ia142eceff56bb763fcca8ddf5b74b83f84bf3539
"}, {'created': '2021-09-17 21:53:02.000000000', 'message': 'Sharing SSH pubkeys across nova-compute apps

SSH keys from nova-compute are now shared across all
nova-compute charm apps.

Optimized relation-set calls, where before it was
(n_apps * n_units * users), now is (n_apps).

Example: for 2 nova-compute apps with 3 nodes each,
it was 24 relation-set calls. Now it is 2.

Closes-Bug: #1468871
Change-Id: Ia142eceff56bb763fcca8ddf5b74b83f84bf3539
'}, {'created': '2021-09-21 18:41:39.000000000', 'message': 'Sharing SSH pubkeys across nova-compute apps

commit_message:
Sharing SSH pubkeys across nova-compute apps

SSH keys from nova-compute are now shared across all
nova-compute charm apps.

Closes-Bug: #1468871
Change-Id: Ia142eceff56bb763fcca8ddf5b74b83f84bf3539

commit_message:
More logging during load balancer creation.

If log level equals INFO it's completely impossible
to troubleshoot load balancer creation issues.
Also we have no information about completed steps during
succesfull load balancer creation.
Logs were added or adjusted according with
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.log/latest/user/guidelines.html

Change-Id: I5ee3e99664d0dccc040585a1d0cd2132c4e711d3

subject: [DVR] Set arp entries only for single IPs given as allowed addr pair
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 14:02:05.000000000', 'message': '[DVR] Set arp entries only for single IPs given as allowed addr pair

In allowed address pairs of the port there can be given not single IP
address but whole CIDR. In such case ARP entries for IPs from such
cidr will not be added in the DVR router namespace.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py

Closes-Bug: #1934912
Change-Id: I7bdefea943379125f93b116bb899446b874d9505
(cherry picked from commit 19375b3e78ad6b635793b716e5ecabd53dc73a76)
(cherry picked from commit d0cf4638f595c38a67974a45d5ef76dcf34e8918)
'}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Set arp entries only for single IPs given as allowed addr pair

In allowed address pairs of the port there can be given not single IP
address but whole CIDR. In such case ARP entries for IPs from such
cidr will not be added in the DVR router namespace.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py

Closes-Bug: #1934912
Change-Id: I7bdefea943379125f93b116bb899446b874d9505
(cherry picked from commit 19375b3e78ad6b635793b716e5ecabd53dc73a76)
(cherry picked from commit d0cf4638f595c38a67974a45d5ef76dcf34e8918)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-11 16:38:14.000000000', 'message': '[cinder] Transition Ussuri to EM

This transition the ussuri branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I3860f7f77c1e3913a686cbf5ec585b0bafd34efe
'}, {'created': '2021-11-12 16:23:49.000000000', 'message': '[cinder] Transition Ussuri to EM

This transitions the ussuri branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Change-Id: I3860f7f77c1e3913a686cbf5ec585b0bafd34efe
'}]
commit_message:
[cinder] Transition Ussuri to EM

This transitions the ussuri branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Change-Id: I3860f7f77c1e3913a686cbf5ec585b0bafd34efe

[{'created': '2021-11-09 07:52:36.000000000', 'message': "[iRMC] Convert the type of irmc_port to int

Fix the bug caused by not converting the port value to int type when the node managed by the `irmc` hardware type.
When using the node managed by the `irmc` hardware type,
if the port number of the bmc address is manually specified,
the following error will occur:

```
Value '443' is not supported for 'irmc_port'
```

However iRMC supports 80 and 443 ports, and default to 443.
The reason for this error is that the type of irmc_port is not converted to int.

Story: #2009671
Task: #43915

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I4e9274de09758fdb468382a7f88298a279f43e92

commit_message:
[iRMC] Convert the type of irmc_port to int

When using the node managed by the `irmc` hardware type,
if the port number of the bmc address is manually specified,
the following error will occur:

```
Value '443' is not supported for 'irmc_port'
```

However iRMC supports 80 and 443 ports, and default to 443.
The reason for this error is that the type of irmc_port is not converted to int.

Story: #2009671
Task: #43915

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I4e9274de09758fdb468382a7f88298a279f43e92
